DESCRIPTION

Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to lay a solid foundation for your career? Do you have a strong drive, enthusiasm, exceptional organizational skills, and a creative mindset? Are you eager to apply theory to real-life situations, improve your marketability, and witness how teamwork operates in a supportive and collaborative environment?

AltGen has the perfect opportunity for a bright-minded graduate, with a degree from a reputable university, to join our team of experts in the renewable energy and sustainability sector as a Business Development and Marketing Intern.

The ideal candidate should be a fast learner, possess excellent communication skills, and excel in a fast-paced environment. We are looking for someone who is marketing savvy, has an eye for detail, and has a keen interest in data and analytics. This internship is a challenging and rewarding opportunity to kickstart your career in a supportive and dynamic environment.

As an intern, your role would entail providing support to our Business Development and Marketing team by effectively conducting research and contributing to ongoing projects. You will have the opportunity to work closely with our highly experienced Business Development and Innovation Director, who is the best in the business with extensive knowledge of business development practices and the renewable energy industry. Your responsibilities will include market research, SEO strategy development and implementation, and aiding in content creation. We are looking for someone who is innovative, results-oriented, self-sufficient, and eager to take on new challenges. You will be expected to jump right into the role and hit the ground running.

If this sounds like the adventure you have been waiting for, please apply now, we would love to hear from you!

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

  • Degree from a reputable institution

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • Out-the-box thinker and outputs orientated with an ability to deliver quickly and autonomously
  • Advanced level of computer proficiency (key requirement)
  • Excellent level of comfort and confidence in reaching out and connecting with people
  • Ability to work in a team and manage-up

RESPONSIBILITIES

In this role, you will be supporting our Business Development and Innovation Director by contributing to ongoing and upcoming projects. Your responsibilities will include generating leads to promote business growth, conducting thorough research, and having a strong inclination towards data and analytics. You will be regularly reaching out and connecting with individuals to establish robust networks and acquire valuable insights. Moreover, you will be accountable for marketing and social media duties such as job posting, platform sourcing, creating innovative content, backlinking, and implementing SEO strategies.

SKILLS

  • Advanced MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint skills
  • Marketing and social media savvy
  • Strong research capabilities
  • Strong interest in data and analytics
  • Proactive and self-managed
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Strong time management and organizational skills
  • Adaptable, performs well under pressure and has efficient prioritisation skills
  • Quick learner, innovative and resilient

WHO IS ALTGEN?

We offer recruitment, consulting and employment services with a focus on recruitment for renewable energy and sustainability jobs across the globe. AltGen is a renewable energy recruitment agency with offices in South Africa, Botswana, Namibia, Kenya, Mauritius, and the United Kingdom, which focuses on developing careers for individuals in our niche space.

With an experienced and passionate team with over 100 years of combined experience, AltGen plays an integral role in the renewable energy and sustainability industry. We operate throughout the world and are rapidly expanding.

Our recruitment agency focuses on jobs in: Solar | Wind | Renewable Energy | Biogas | Biomass | Energy Management | Energy Efficiency | Green Buildings | Green Tech | Photovoltaics | Solar Thermal | Energy Storage | Battery Systems | Off-grid | Hydro | CSP | CPV | IoT | AI | AgriTech | FinTech | Green Hydrogen | Wheeling | Energy Trading | ESG | Sustainability | Carbon Management.

Job Description

About our Client:

Our purpose is making life better. We are a global healthcare provider delivering measurable clinical quality through a diversified offering and a people-centered approach.

Role

Analytics Manager, reporting to the Head: Analytics.

The successful candidate will play a key role in the realization of an organization driven by evidence-based decision-making, and as such, this is a strategically important position. The role is responsible for ensuring that senior management, business and other key stakeholders are equipped with insights from data that can inform their strategic decisions, but more than that, for designing and building the engine for the delivery of data insights.

Key Responsibilities

  • Ensure that our client can drive business value through reporting and analytics.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand analytics needs and how these evolve.
  • Responsible for clarifying client requirements and translate analytical concepts into client-friendly terminology, meeting all analytical requirements.
  • Oversee the analytics infrastructure and toolkit and ensure that it remains fit for purpose in support of organizational goals, researching best-in-breed solutions on an ongoing basis.
  • Oversee and manage a team of data scientists, machine learning engineers and domain experts.
  • Develop and nurture a high-performance, quality-obsessed, collaborative culture with other leaders in the broader data and analytics team.
  • Demonstrate thought leadership in the application of advanced analytics to solve business problems
  • Drive innovation in the analysis of data.
  • Be accountable for applying advanced predictive and prescriptive analytics that uses cutting-edge data science and machine learning techniques to guide evidence-driven decision-making.
Effectively communicate to senior management, business, and staff in the data and analytics team the value and importance of analytics and the business possibilities that flow from its insights.

Required Experience/Qualifications

  • Honors-level degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Economics or a cognate analytical field, or other equivalent qualifications.
  • 5+ years of experience in an analytics environment, using descriptive and predictive analytics to inform business decisions.
  • 1+ years of management experience.
  • Strong leadership and communication skills.
  • Familiarity with relevant analytics tools, including big data solutions.
  • Healthcare experience will be a definitive advantage.


Salary

R75600.00

Business Unit: Discovery Health
Function: Data Sciences
Date: 24 Jun 2023
Discovery Health

Data Scientist

About Discovery

Discovery’s core purpose is to make people healthier and to enhance and protect their lives. We seek out and invest in exceptional individuals who understand and support our core purpose, and whose own values align with those of Discovery. Our fast-paced and dynamic environment enables smart, self-driven people to be their best. As global thought leaders, Discovery is passionate about innovating in order to not only achieve financial success, but to ignite positive and meaningful change within our society.

About (Data Science Unit – Operations Intelligence)

The position available is in the Discovery Health Operations Intelligence unit. We apply predictive analytics, big data and analytic skills to provide unique data-driven answers to exciting problems in servicing, operations and other areas of the business. The team has access to structured and unstructured data and makes use of the latest international innovative big data architecture.

Key Purpose

In this role you will be involved in creating opportunities that delight our customers by leveraging Discovery’s vast clinical, demographic and operational data. Using this data with predictive modelling and machine learning techniques you will have a direct impact on strategic initiatives to support Discovery’s world-class operations. The successful applicant will be working within a highly specialized and growing team investigating ways to optimize and improve client services for Discovery’s client schemes.

Areas of responsibility may include but not limited to

  • Connecting with a multitude of stakeholders to understand the data in a healthcare and operational context
  • Mining large structured and unstructured datasets to find new insights to inform operational efficiency and ‘ member- delight’ interaction strategies
  • Research and application of the most up to date machine learning algorithms and AI techniques
  • Present data and model findings in a way that provides actionable insights to business users
  • Monitoring model performance
  • Improve processes and databases where opportunities arise
  • Conduct end-to-end analysis of data; from data gathering, processing, analysis, to insight synthesis and presentation - to measure the causal impact of campaigns and product launches.

Personal Attributes and Skills

  • Expert in data science programming languages such as R, Python, Scala
  • Expert in data manipulation skills including SQL to extract, transform and load data
  • Experience in interactive data exploration and data-driven story telling
  • Understanding and application of Big Data and distributed computing principles
  • Hands on experience with Big Data systems will be preferred
  • Strong analytical and statistical knowledge with an understanding of the latest machine learning algorithms for both structured and unstructured data
  • Ability to formulate problem statements and develop a plan for tackling the problem
  • Strong ability to communicate findings and recommendations from data (visual, verbal and written)
  • Integration and implementation experience
  • A passion for data exploration and analytics
  • Self-starter
  • Willingness to learn and grow exponentially
  • A restless curiosity towards data and uncovering unknown correlations
  • Ability to work cohesively in a team environment and balance multiple priorities
  • A team player who can work alone when required and without supervision
  • High level of attention to detail, resilience, enthusiasm, energy and drive

Education and Experience

  • Honours or Master’s degree in either Data Science, Statistics, or Applied Mathematics with some experience in software engineering, computer science or working with big disparate sets of data, OR
  • Honours or Master’s degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering with solid experience in statistical modelling, data mining and machine learning
  • Other analytical qualifications will also be considered if accompanied by the relevant experience
  • Experience in marketing analytics advantageous
  • A minimum of 2 years’ work experience in a data science position

Employment Equity

The Company’s approved Employment Equity Plan and Targets will be considered as part of the recruitment process. As an Equal Opportunities employer, we actively encourage and welcome people with various disabilities to apply.

EMPLOYMENT EQUITY

The Company’s approved Employment Equity Plan and Targets will be considered as part of the recruitment process. As an Equal Opportunities employer, we actively encourage and welcome people with various disabilities to apply.

Assistant Demand Planner

Essity is a leading global hygiene and health company which develops, produces, and sells Health & Medical, Consumer Tissue and Professional Hygiene products and solutions and has a strong global presence.

We are looking for an Assistant Demand Planner to join our Demand Planning based in Pinetown, South Africa. We are looking for an individual who possess strong inventory and analytical skills, passionate about what they do and has the ability to add value and walk the path in growing our business with us!

About the Role

The Assistant Demand Planner will be responsible for ensuring all sales warehouses are timeously replenished and adequately stock to meet in-market demand and assisting with all activities associated with developing and improving the sales forecast. This role will report directly to the Demand Planner.

We’re looking for people who embody our values, who are not afraid to challenge, innovate, move at a fast pace . Someone who support business performance delivery with a customer centric and continuous improvement mindset. If this is you, we’d love to talk.

What You Will Do

  • Responsible for inventory analysis, reporting and analysis;

  • Sales/Market Warehouse inventory planning, review and replenishments;

  • Monitor, investigate and report demand variations;

  • Support with demand analysis, forecast development and improvements;

  • Monitor Warehouse service levels and drive superior performance;

  • Collaborate with Supply Planning and Customer Service to drive on time in full (OTIF) fulfilment;

  • Timeous preparation and submission of management reporting requirements;

  • Actively develop and maintain stakeholder relationships both internally and externally;

  • Support the Demand Planner with projects and general daily operational requirements.

Who You Are

  • Must have matric with further qualification in Supply Chain or Data Analytics;

  • Minimum of 3 years’ demand planning or assistant demand planning and data analysis experience in Manufacturing or FMCG medical device industry;

  • Must have excellent computer skills, proficient in - Microsoft Office (especially Excel), SAP, APO/ERP Software;

  • Must be organized, skilled in reporting with attention to detail, accuracy and be deadline driven;

  • Must be a strong collaborator with good communication skills (verbal, written and listening) and be fluent in English;

  • Must have the ability to drive performance, processes, and solutions forward.

What We Can Offer You

At Essity, we believe everyone's learning and professional development is unique and want to empower employees to reach their full potential in a winning culture motivated by a powerful purpose.
Collaborative and Inclusive Culture | Empowering & Engaged Leaders | Working with Powerful Purpose & Sustainable Impact | Learning and Growing in your Career | Supporting Well-being & Sustainable Working Life | Life-changing Innovations | Competitive Total Rewards

Location

Pinetown, South Africa

Together, we are improving lives, every day.

Working at Essity is not just a career; it is a chance to directly make the world a healthier, more hygienic and safer place. With impactful innovations coupled with sustainable solutions, we strive to reach more people every year with the necessary and essential solutions for well-being.

Impact is the global leader in Partnership Automation, working with innovative brands like Ticketmaster, Levi's, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Uber to help them manage their online affiliate, influencer, brand to brand, and content partnerships. The Impact Partnership Cloud covers the full life partnership lifecycle including onboarding, tracking ads and paying partners, recruiting for new partners, data and marketing intelligence, and protection from fraud. Founded in 2008, Impact has grown to over 500 employees and ten offices across Europe, the United States, Africa, and Asia so there is plenty of opportunity for growth and advancement.

Your Role at Impact:

The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing and interpreting large and complex datasets to identify patterns and trends, develop insights and provide data-driven recommendations to support business decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in data analysis, reporting and forecasting with the ability to communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders ranging from associate to executive level.

The Senior Data Analyst will fulfill a key role in the development and expansion of a strong data analytics competency, with special focus on developing data and reporting outputs aligned with key business objectives across the organization. The Analyst will be a contributing member of the analytics center of excellence and help drive adoption of industry best practices relating to data analytics and visualization.

What You'll Do:

  • Extract and analyze data from various sources including relational databases (mySQL, postgres), big data technologies (BigQuery, Kudu, Impala, SingleStore, Hive), file sources (parquet, ORC, avro, csv, xlsx) and reporting systems (Looker, DOMO)
  • Identify, create and maintain master datasets
  • Lead data stewardship initiatives
  • Clean and manipulate data to ensure high quality and integrity of reporting outputs
  • Drive adoption of data mart and reporting outputs in the broader organization
  • Contribute to and compile technical specifications for new data assets (marts, tables, views, cubes)
  • Collaborate closely with data engineers and ETL developers to close the gap between stakeholders' data needs and development efforts
  • Analyze source systems and help identify business logic embedded in the underlying datasets
  • Use statistical techniques to identify trends and derive patterns and insights embedded in the data
  • Identify and communicate data quality and data validation issues in productionalized datasets
  • Create visualizations and dashboards to present a rich narrative driven by data analysis findings
  • Become the point person and subject matter expert with regard to data assets produced and maintained by the data mart squad
  • Develop and maintain data models, dashboards and reports to support business decisions
  • Perform ad-hoc data analysis to determine suitability of a data source for use in data marts and reporting outputs or to assess key performance indicators (KPIs)
  • Communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
  • Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation
  • Staying up-to-date with new technologies and industry trends in data analysis
  • Mentor and train junior colleagues
  • Review junior colleagues' work and ensure it is fit for purpose and audience appropriate
  • Stay abreast of and advocate for industry best practices with regard to data analysis, data stewardship and data visualization
  • Actively participate in the hiring process and performance management of team members

What You Have:

  • Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science or a related field
  • 6+ years of experience in a data analysis, business intelligence or data engineering role
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong Python and SQL coding skills
  • Strong data analysis and data visualization skills
  • Experience with the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and integrated technologies preferred
  • Experience with DataBricks, PySpark and BigQuery highly advantageous
  • Expert data wrangler (data cleaning, manipulation and preparation)
  • Experience leading teams or projects
  • Experience with machine learning libraries, tools and protocols (supervised & unsupervised learning)
  • Experience with standard statistical modeling and forecasting methodologies
  • Experience with no-sql data systems beneficial (HBase, Redis, Kafka)
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, SSRS/SSAS, Looker or QlikView
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Experience working in the marketing technology industry beneficial

Munich Reinsurance Company of Africa Limited (MRoA) has been operating in South Africa for 50 years, although the Munich Re (Group) was active on the Continent via Munich Re in Munich for some years prior to commencing the Southern African operation in Johannesburg in 1968. The Head Office of MRoA is in Johannesburg, with a client service Life office situated in Cape Town.


Munich Re’s Global Digital Communications section designs, develops and implements external digital communications and marketing channels such as website, emails and our presence on social media platforms. In addition, the section supports Munich Re’s business units globally in their digitalization and digital marketing activities. We are looking for a skilled and motivated Website Consultant to strengthen our team.


The Website Consultant will be responsible for collaborating with international cross-functional teams to conceptualize and implement user-centered web experiences that meet business objectives and improve website performance.


This role will directly report to the Global Head of Digital Communications.


Your job:


  • Conduct user research and analysis to identify areas for improvement on the websites.
  • Consult and collaborate with internal stakeholders, including product managers, developers, webmasters, marketing business partner and content owners to implement changes and improve website functionality.
  • Use data and feedback to optimize the user experience and conversions, including improving navigation, layout, and content.
  • Manage website projects from initial set up and concept to go live based on an existing component stack.
  • Create user flows and wireframes to articulate website and component concepts and interactions.
  • Develop prototypes and conduct user testing to validate component concepts and gather feedback.
  • Collaborate with visual designers and developers to ensure components designs are implemented effectively.
  • Create and maintain a consistent user-centric experience across the website, ensuring that all pages are user-friendly and intuitive.
  • Continuously monitor website metrics and user feedback from internal and external stakeholders to identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Participate in design reviews and provide constructive feedback to other team members.
  • Quality assurance of the website with regard to corporate design, spelling and broken links.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in UX design, web design, and technology.

Your Profile:

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as digital communication, website management, marketing or web design.
  • At least 5 years of experience in website optimization, ideally in a global corporate organization.
  • Excellent knowledge in using CMS tools like AEM.
  • Experience using analytics and A/B testing tools such as Adobe Analytics.
  • Strong knowledge about accessibility standards.
  • Strong knowledge of design and prototyping tools such as Figma or Adobe Creative Suite.
  • Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Empathy and a sense of humor.

Our Benefits:

  • Life and Health Benefits.
  • Retirement Benefits.
  • Hybrid working environment.
  • Bonus Scheme.
  • Employee Assistance Program.
  • Wellness Programs.
  • Global Mobility.

Purpose of the Job

To ensure that the Distribution Centre is Health and Safety compliant. The Health & Safety Officer serves to ensure emergency preparedness and incident response at each of our Distribution centers. Moreover this role is responsible for contractor management, emergency coordination, risk analysis and incident investigation.


Job Objectives

Contractor management

  • Understand the legal principles under which the permit to work process is defined and conduct contractor audits.
  • Understand and apply the legal principle pertaining to the OHS scope of authority and issue a permit to work which is limited to the Scope of authority.
  • Draw up and maintain an audit schedule and audit programme for contractor audits.'
  • Maintain an up-to-date data base od contractors and service providers that have undergone the audit process and are in the possession of a valid permit to work.
  • Carry out contractor and visitor induction, conduct contractor audits and issue a permit to work for the various Supply Chain Business units.
  • Compile statistical analytics, define KPI objectives and present to management on milestones achieved.

Emergency Co-ordination

  • Review existing emergency contingency measures against relevant legislation.
  • Ensure the organisation can respond to actual emergencies and supply periodic reports to management.
  • Test emergency contingency measures in line with regulating requirement and provide periodic report of management.
  • Carry out emergency evacuation post-mortem investigation and provide solutions for continual improvement.

Risk Analysis

  • Ensure that the organisation takes appropriate action to address risk in the workplace.
  • Keep upto date with legislative developments, technological advancement opportunities to mitigate HSE risk.
  • Conduct risk assessment updates in line with legal and regulative requirements.
  • Put programmes in place with objective to mitigate significant HSE risk.
  • Ensuring that the risk associated to change is quantified before the actual change occurs in the workplace.
  • Ensure that safety critical devices that require periodical maintena nee, calibration and regulative registration are kept up to date.
  • Conduct communication and awareness campaigns based on incidents that have taken place and provide remedial recommendations.

Incident Investigation

  • Conduct incident investigation in line with Section of the OHS Act and Shoprite Standards.
  • Liaise with Department of Employment and Labour Inspectors. Host DoEL Visits.

Job Description – Data Science Manager– Level 7

Excited to join us at Accenture and work with highly skilled and motivated individuals? Are you keen to work closely with and learn from global experts? To drive innovation to shape the future to improve the way we work and live?

If you have unbounded energy, curiosity, an entrepreneurial attitude, and love to work in diverse teams, then you need to join us.

What's the Job?

The role of a Data Science Manager involves solutioning Data Science, Analytics, and Machine Learning projects while driving sales, managing, and supervising project delivery, mentoring teams, building new capabilities, and contributing to thought leadership while developing new skills. The ideal candidate should seamlessly collaborate with client teams to position data science capabilities and work with them to deliver on data science, analytics, and machine learning projects.

To succeed in this position, the candidate should possess strong data science, consultative, business, and communication skills. The candidate should be familiar with the challenges of using statistics in a business setting, including incomplete or biased data, large data sets, low signal-to-noise ratios, high variance, and multiple objective functions. Creativity and resourcefulness are essential, and the candidate must be proficient in traditional statistical methodologies as well as newer techniques such as machine learning, computational statistics, data mining, and big data.

Who are we looking for?

BSc, MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or related science field from a well-established University

  • Minimum of 3 to 5 years of proven working experience in Data Science & Machine Learning.
  • Experience in leading teams of 5-8 people.
  • Solid theoretical and hands-on knowledge of Econometrics, Statistics, Data Mining, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence concepts.
  • Exceptional programming skills in Data Science scripting (in languages such as Python / R / Scala / Julia).
  • Analytical and critical thinking skills with demonstrated ability to create effective Data Science strategies.
  • Ability to communicate results effectively and explain technical methodologies to a non-technical audience.
  • Demonstrated ability in the application of Data Science & Machine Learning preferable in the mining, chemical, oil & gas industries, alternatively finance, media & telecommunications or retail will be considered.
  • Ability to work as a team player in multinational project teams.
  • Considered a plus:
    • Experience with Cloud Technologies (MS Azure, GCP, AWS)
    • Familiarity with Deep Learning concepts & tools (H2O, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Theano, etc.)
    • Understanding of the machine learning lifecycle and hands-on experience with ML Ops
    • Experience in SQL and interpretation of large databases (via tools such as Hive, Spark, HBASE, HDFS, Kafka, Kudu)
    • Visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau)
    • Working under an Agile Framework with CICD principles

Key Responsibilities

  • Collect and transform data from disparate data sources by interacting with client’s IT team and various operational data sources
  • Design models, algorithms, and implement solutions that will help companies address their challenges.
  • Extract, visualize and communicate insights from data, and solutions.
  • Interpret analytical models, conduct analysis to gain insights into the root of clients’ problem, propose potential solutions to their problems, and assist in quantifying those solutions.
  • Create high impact business strategies and roadmaps for solution implementation, to help clients reap benefits of data analytics on an ongoing basis.
  • Supervise and mentor a team of analysts and consultants to create solutions.
  • Conduct project and issue management (status reporting, issue reporting, budget reporting) for assigned scope of work, and make decisions that impact the team through regular consultation with senior management.
  • Adhere to strategic direction set by senior management. Interact with client and internal senior management on a regular basis.

Primary characteristics for candidate

  • Experienced data scientist with track record of delivering Data Science solutions
  • Experience in leading a multinational team, or being a senior member in the team
  • Ability to create and execute on the solution’s project plan
  • Experience in contributing to the development of client proposals
  • Well established in at least one domain – Preferably Resources else financial services, media and telecommunication will be considered)

Our Company:

If you are looking to join a team where your opinion is valued, your contributions are noticed, and enjoy working with fun and talented people from all over the world then this is the place for you.

If you have a desire to work in an organisation that is:

  • Passionate about its people
  • Focused on delivering the very best tech to our customers
  • Offering the flexibility to work how and where you are most successful
  • Obsessed with our customer's success
  • The leading SaaS platform to automate partnerships - affiliate, influencer, technology partners, and more!
  • Entrepreneurial in spirit with a culture that rewards collaboration and curiosity
  • Obsessed with making a difference in business and to the wider community

Impact is the global leader in Partnership Automation, working with innovative brands like Ticketmaster, Levi's, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Uber to help them manage their online affiliate, influencer, brand to brand, and content partnerships. The Impact Partnership Cloud covers the full life partnership lifecycle including onboarding, tracking ads and paying partners, recruiting for new partners, data and marketing intelligence, and protection from fraud. Founded in 2008, Impact has grown to over 500 employees and ten offices across Europe, the United States, Africa, and Asia so there is plenty of opportunity for growth and advancement.

Your Role at Impact:

The data analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing and interpreting large and complex datasets to identify patterns and trends, surface facts and develop insights, aiding the team in delivering data-driven recommendations to support business decisions.

The ideal candidate will have a technical background and experience performing data analysis, building reports and producing forecasting models in a professional environment. The data analyst needs to be a clear communicator that can confidently interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders and present analysis and research findings to the broader team.

Data pun: "which way did the programmer go? He went data way"

What You'll Do:

  • Extract and analyze data from various sources including relational databases (mySQL, postgres), big data technologies (BigQuery, Kudu, Impala, SingleStore, Hive), file sources (parquet, ORC, avro, csv, xlsx) and reporting systems (Looker, DOMO)
  • Conduct data analysis, surface insights and present recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
  • Create visualizations, dashboards and reports to present data analysis findings
  • Use statistical techniques to identify trends and derive patterns and insights embedded in the data
  • Assist with the identification, creation and maintenance of master datasets
  • Actively participate in and occasionally lead data stewardship initiatives
  • Clean and manipulate data to ensure high quality and integrity of reporting outputs
  • Help drive adoption of data mart and reporting outputs in the broader organization
  • Contribute to and compile technical specifications for new data assets (marts, tables, views, cubes)
  • Collaborate closely with data and analytics engineers to close the gap between stakeholders' data needs and development efforts
  • Analyze source systems and help identify business logic embedded in the underlying datasets
  • Identify and communicate data quality and data validation issues in productionalized datasets
  • Build and maintain dashboards to support business stakeholders
  • Perform ad-hoc data analysis to determine suitability of a data source for use in data marts and reporting outputs or to assess key performance indicators (KPIs)
  • Troubleshoot process failures and identify opportunities for automation
  • Help train and up-skill new team members

What You Have:

  • Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science or a related field
  • 3+ years of experience in a data analysis, business intelligence or data engineering role
  • Developed analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Python and SQL coding skills
  • Developed data analysis and data visualization skills
  • Experience with the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and integrated technologies preferred
  • Exposure to DataBricks, PySpark and BigQuery highly advantageous
  • Experience with data wrangling (data cleaning, manipulation and preparation)
  • Exposure to machine learning libraries, tools and protocols (supervised & unsupervised learning)
  • Experience with standard statistical modeling and forecasting methodologies
  • Exposure to no-sql data systems beneficial (HBase, Redis, Kafka)
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, SSRS/SSAS, Looker or QlikView
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Experience working in the marketing technology industry beneficial

Nice to have:

  • Affiliate & Partnerships Industry Fundamentals Certification by PXA

Benefits/Perks:

  • Unlimited PTO policy
    • Take the time off that you need. We are truly committed to a positive work-life balance, recognising that it is important to be happy and fulfilled in both
  • Training & Development
    • Learning the advanced partnership automation products
  • Medical Aid and Provident Fund
    • Group schemes with Discovery & Bonitas for medical aid
    • Group scheme with Momentum for provident fund
  • Stock Options
    • 3-year vesting schedule pending Board approval
  • Internet Allowance
  • Flexible work hours
  • Casual work environment

Our client is seeking a detail-oriented Market Research Analyst to conduct surveys and analyze customer preferences and statistical data.

Your role will involve providing valuable insights to support customers in their decision-making processes related to product designs, pricing, and promotions.

As a successful Market Research Analyst, you will have the ability to independently analyze qualitative data, identify trends, assess strategies, and evaluate competition, with the ultimate goal of enhancing competitiveness.

Your responsibilities will include gathering and interpreting market research data, generating reports, and presenting findings to stakeholders.

We are looking for a self-motivated professional with strong analytical skills and a deep understanding of market dynamics.

Responsibilities

  • Collect data on consumers, competitors and market place and consolidate information into actionable items, reports and presentations
  • Understand business objectives and design surveys to discover prospective customers’ preferences
  • Compile and analyze statistical data using modern and traditional methods to collect it
  • Perform valid and reliable market research SWOT analysis
  • Interpret data, formulate reports and make recommendations
  • Use online market research and catalogue findings to databases
  • Provide competitive analysis on various companies’ market offerings, identify market trends, pricing/business models, sales and methods of operation
  • Evaluate program methodology and key data to ensure that data on the releases are accurate and the angle of the release is correct
  • Remain fully informed on market trends, other parties researches and implement best practices

Requirements and skills

  • Proven Market Research Analysis experience
  • Ability to interpret large amounts of data and to multi-task
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Excellent knowledge of statistical packages (SPSS, SAS or similar), databases and MS Office
  • Search engines, web analytics and business research tools acumen
  • Familiarity with CRM programs
  • Adequate knowledge of data collection methods (polls, focus groups, surveys etc)
  • Working knowledge of data warehousing, modelling and mining
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking
  • BS degree in Statistics, Marketing or related fiel

Company Description
-ABOUT DE BEERS MARINE:

De Beers Marine (DBM) is based in Cape Town, South Africa and is part of the De Beers group. Activities managed include Marine exploration, geophysical surveys, sampling, mining, ship conversion, upgrades and maintenance, large project management, engineering design and mining system equipment builds. DBM executes world leading R&D in marine mining practices resulting in the most successful and advanced marine mining equipment and operations globally.

ABOUT PROJECT PLUS:

Project Plus is a newly launched Business Unit (BU) in De Beers Marine which will provide the full suite of project management and project controls support services to medium and large scale capital projects within the greater De Beers and Anglo American Group of companies.


Job Description
-De Beers Marine Project Plus requires the services of a Project Planner, to support the successful project delivery of medium and large capital projects for our clients within the greater De Beers and Anglo American Group of companies, by ensuring the integrity of the project time management process and its application in developing, monitoring, controlling and reporting on project schedules.

The Planner takes accountability for developing and managing the schedules for medium and large size projects. He/she will be responsible to ensure:

  • Development of project master schedule plans including basis of schedule.
  • Development and updates to the project master schedules incl. maintaining alignment (and integration) of all contractor schedules.
  • Monitoring all associated detailed schedules, providing accurate reports on progress, variance to plan, root causes and remedial actions.
  • Providing forward looking activity forecasts to proactively manage future work.
  • Monitoring the greater environment in order to identify potential risks to the schedules.
  • Deliver a high quality planning service to all Stakeholders

KEY PERFORMANCE AREAS:

  • Develop and maintain integrated Project Master Plans/Schedules.
  • Coordinating with project team members and stakeholders to establish and define schedule requirements, including sequencing and alignment of all contractor schedules with the Master schedule.
  • Development of the project work breakdown structures.
  • Monitoring and controlling against tasks, milestones and deliverables.
  • Critical path and opportunity analysis to optimise the schedule and cost.
  • Assessing risks to the critical path(s) and developing mitigating (recovery) actions to achieve the project schedules.
  • Identifying and communicating schedule conflicts, resource constraints, time constraints etc.
  • Monitoring (measure progress), detailed reporting and control (follow up /feedback). Trending by application of Earned Value principles.
  • Resource loading where applicable.
  • Establishing and maintaining planning standards.

  • Qualifications
    -A qualification in Project Planning and supported by a Degree, BTech or Diploma within the Engineering field is recommended.
  • 4-5 Years’ experience within a project office environment, with at least 4 years multidisciplinary project planning and execution experience.
  • Previous construction management and contractor management experience will be an advantage.
  • Relevant project planning and scheduling experience using Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project.
  • Highly skilled with the Microsoft Office suite.

REQUIRED SKILLS / COMPETENCIES:

  • Full proficiency with Primavera P6 Planning software and MS Project.
  • Full proficiency w.r.t. project planning principles:- timeframes, resourcing, dependencies and critical paths and earned value.
  • Good knowledge and experience of the Primavera P6 Risk Analysis (PRA) software and process
  • Full proficiency w.r.t. project Work and System breakdown structures.
  • Full proficiency w.r.t. progress measurement and reporting.
  • Sound understanding of Project costing methodologies.
  • Collaboration and the ability to work in a multi-disciplinary, cross-functional team environment
  • Highly organized.
  • Good time management skills.
  • Strong analytical abilities with problem solving skills.
  • The ability to communicate at all levels, including good written and verbal communication.
  • Schedule trend and risk analysis.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Self-motivated.

Additional Information
-What we offer

When you join De Beers, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package, but more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We are a large, successful multinational company – and we are still growing all the time.

Who we are

De Beers is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities and countries in which we operate and for society at large. De Beers is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives.

How we are committed to your safety

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

Inclusion and Diversity

De Beers is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

Background checks

Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

How to apply

To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

Should you not have heard from Venetia Mine’s HR Department four weeks after the closing date, kindly consider your application as unsuccessful.

Closing date: 25 July 2023

display_title: Data Migration Consultant - ROA - STS (Source to Settle)
job_description:
As a data migration consultant, you'll be responsible for assisting with source to settle (S2S) and source to settle data migration projects. You will also be expected to assist in the recovery of our databases. In this role, you will work closely with your project manager and other team members on the day-to-day running of each project as well as liaising between departments when required.


Requirements


  • Responsible for the Data Mapping and Migration of the Vendor Master, Purchasing Agreements as well as Open Purchasing Documents
  • Experience in Procurement as well as Product Costing
  • Understanding SSIS packages as well as the D365 DMF (Data Migration Framework) with Batch handling
  • Manage, facilitate, and drive the extraction criteria, data cleansing, object mapping, field mapping and value mapping for the ETL process
  • Manage, facilitate, and drive the filling in of the templates by the Business for the Construct process
  • Facilitate Issue resolution where there are load errors (Defects logged in DevOps)
  • Status reporting per functional area as and when needed
  • Engage with business resources per stream to resolve data queries


Qualifications


  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science or a related field required
  • 5 year of experience in data analytics preferred
  • 8 years of experience in data migration or data extraction/analysis preferred.
  • 5years of experience in a multi-location environment with strong leadership and/or management experience is required

We are looking for truly unique people who believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive environment, where our people are cared for, happy and inspired to build an extraordinary place to work. We are looking for a creative problem solver that thrives when presented with a challenge and aligns with our awesome values and culture. We see ourselves as a company that enables its team to thrive, with the top value behind the work we do being trust, which means total flexibility and independence.

Our solutions range from cloud-based solutions that are AI-Powered, machine learning predictive tech that keeps our clients ahead of customer behavior, to centralized, data-visualized, single dashboards, that are custom-built solutions automating and centralizing all elements of the management process. We also predict what our customer needs, what they buy, and how much of it they buy. Our solutions have revolutionized all forecasting abilities from pricing, inventory, customer behavior, and sales analytics.

Our vision for our Junior Payroll Administrator is to contribute to the efficiency and precision of the Payroll and Benefits function by ensuring that employees are paid on time and correctly. Further, to provide employees with relevant information as required by the BCEA, and to contribute to group policies and procedures to ensure the sound management and control of the department.

Responsibilities include

Input Processing

  • Collecting of salary input documents
  • Scrutinizing of salary documents for abnormalities
  • Ensure all abnormalities and incomplete documents to be logged on input query list and distributed to the People Team
  • Obtaining outstanding documents when necessary
  • Prepare documents for processing
  • Process input documents – capture onto the payroll system
  • Ensure that all input is captured accurately and on time and take corrective action when necessary
  • Ensure all data is inputted by the deadline date
  • Ensure timeous action is taken relating to finalization of queries to ensure service delivery continues
  • Ensure that EE records are updated with documentation and that documents are readily accessible and readily available upon request
  • Adhere to all deadlines applicable to the payroll department
  • Adhere to company procedures and policies
  • Ensure the availability of documents captured within the applicable month if and when queried
  • Apply audit requirements to everyday tasks

Salary Administration

  • Ensure that EE records are up to date at all times Provide feedback to employees and management regarding queries within 48 hours
  • Ensure timeous verification of personal and bank details on CRS DIY portal
  • Assist users to access documents such as payslips, tax certificates, salary letters, etc. from the DIY portal
  • Report abnormalities to line manager for clarification
  • Highlight departmental input and effectiveness/errors
  • Salary Clearing variances to be investigated and corrected to ensure up to date and reconciled account status
  • Loading payments (EFT’s)
  • Ensure all stop payments and recalls are done by deadline date accompanied by reversals if and when necessary
  • Ensure reversals of payments are done within the applicable month to ensure corrective action was taken for recalls

Reporting (Payroll and Migrate)

  • Ensure goals and objectives are met
  • Ensure all errors on exception reports are corrected timeously
  • Scrutinise all auditing error reports and correct immediately and provide Quality Specialist with feedback or confirmation once corrected
  • All reports to be checked and corrected to minimize month end queries all reports to be signed off
  • Maintain Audit requirements
  • Ensure accuracy of Contract Dates

Benefits Administration

  • Ensure all Medical Aid applications are complete and correct as per Company Policies and Medical Aid Plans
  • Ensure application forms are submitted on time and captured within the applicable month using SMP as starting point
  • Ensure all EE are on Pension as per Company Policy and criteria
  • Ensure that proof can be provide at all times regarding submissions and payment to 3rd parties – record keeping
  • Garnishees’ queries to be dealt with directly
  • UI19 documents to be generated immediately upon receipt of termination documents
  • Abnormalities to be logged, communicated and resolved and feedback communicated

Your skills and experience include

  • Diploma/NQF level 5
  • 2-3 years admin experience, capturing data and verifying if remuneration-related issues
  • Computer literacy
  • Attention to detail
  • Relationship building
  • Deadline driven
  • Numerical reasoning

Key personal attributes include

  • Communication
  • Organisational commitment
  • Teamwork & collaboration
  • Relationship building
  • Agility
  • Performance & results driven
  • Continuous growth & improvement
  • Resilience & stress management
  • Service excellence
  • Analysis & problem solving
  • Planning & prioritisation
  • Quality & detail excellence
  • Financial acumen

Our client has an opportunity available for a Data Insights and Analytics Lead to be based in the Parktown area.

Requirements:

  • The following degrees would be preferred for the role
    o Bachelor’s degree in Business Science
    o Bachelor’s degree in Data Science
    o Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics
    o Bachelor’s degree with Mathematics and/or Applied Mathematics
    o Bachelor’s degree in Engineering
    o Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science
  • At least 5 years’ experience in a position monitoring, managing, manipulating and drawing insights from data
  • At least 3 years’ experience leading a team.
  • Minimum experience of 5 years working with BI tools
  • Must have experience in data science, statistical analytics and experience in understanding the business requirements and customer journey

KPAs:

  • Build, develop and maintain data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards and performance metrics that support key business decisions
  • Design and build technical processes to address business issues
  • Oversee the data/report requests process: tracking requests submitted, prioritization, approval, etc.
  • Recruit, train, develop and supervise analyst-level team members

What better way to kick start your career with IQbusiness, a Proudly South African management consulting firm focused on growing people and business in South Africa?

Our programme is designed to give passionate and enthusiastic graduates the opportunity to hone their abilities through various forms of consultant training and garner valuable experience by exposing them to the workplace, through internal and external project engagements.

A Management Consultant is a versatile role, one that has core skills with the ability to adapt well to change, but also to leverage off various tools and technologies in order to deliver in the toughest environments. The growth of an IQbusiness Intern maybe in one or many of the below skill sets:
Business Analysis, Process Engineering, Project Management Accounting, Governance, Risk and Compliance Data (Engineering, Analysis and Analytics)Customer Experience, CRM Platforms Change Management, Agility, Learning and Development Research

Minimum Requirements
Qualifications:
  • Completed Matric
  • Completed undergraduate Tertiary Qualification
  • Ability to the travel locally between IQbusiness and our clients, if required


Our Expectations

IQbusiness is different, we walk differently, we talk differently, we even look different, but that’s what makes us unique. We’re our own kind of genuine and we expect to see how genuine you are.

If you become apart of IQbusiness these are some of our expectations.

Get involved

  • IQbusiness is more than just a business, it’s about making a difference within the IQbusiness community but also externally to everyone we interact with.
  • Be apart of the bigger picture, attend workshops and bootcamps, go the extra mile and join an initiative, put yourself out there to create a name for yourself.

Gain exposure

  • There are many opportunities to get involved across projects and environments within IQbusiness. The more exposure one obtains the better the journey of upskilling and understanding will be. Look for the below areas to advance.
  • Client project – Shadowing and/or supervised project delivery. Learning and applying specific methods, tools and techniques to help deliver on a project to a client.
  • Internal Project/Support – Engage internally with IQbusiness and learn how the business functions. Assist and add value to help in attaining the strategic goals. Support in the day to day by always being open to a learning experience.
  • Cross Functional – Diversify your knowledge and skills by engaging and learning across environments and projects. Show adaptability and impetus by taking on different projects and be able to show resolve in finding a solution.

Be the best version of yourself

  • We want you to be you!! With the key values of IQbusiness in mind, we want each individual to pave their path and grow within IQbusiness.
  • Collaborate, share and learn from one another and across the business. Show passion and curiosity to learn and develop new skills, but also hone older ones.
  • Be caring and supportive by putting up a hand to lend a hand and understand that not all being done will change the world, but it may just help someone for that day.
  • Be adaptable and resilient in smaller more monotonous pieces of work, knowing that as you develop the bigger more extravagant projects will come.

Business Unit: Discovery Insure
Function: Data Sciences
Date: 7 Jul 2023

Discovery – Insure


Data Scientist (Senior)


About Discovery

Discovery’s core purpose is to make people healthier and to enhance and protect their lives. We seek out and invest in exceptional individuals who understand and support our core purpose, and whose own values align with those of Discovery. Our fast-paced and dynamic environment enables smart, self-driven people to be their best. As global thought leaders, Discovery is passionate about innovating in order to not only achieve financial success, but to ignite positive and meaningful change within our society.


About Discovery Insure

Discovery Insure is committed to creating a nation of great drivers and building better businesses through our innovative Shared-value Insurance model. Discovery Insure is South Africa’s fastest growing short-term insurance company with comprehensive products that provide protection against current and emerging risks facing clients in the motor, home and business insurance sectors.

Vitality Drive, an internationally-recognised and award-winning programme, is a key differentiator in the market that incentivises and rewards clients for driving well. The Vitality Drive programme has been scaled to local and international markets which now include Europe and the Middle East.

The company employs over 1 000 people who are committed to putting our customers and financial advisers first by providing unique and innovative solutions and cover.


Key Purpose

Maintain and develop the VitalityDrive scoring platform in AWS. To analyze large amounts of data to provide core business value and key insights and enhance business processes that rely on large amounts of data.


Areas of responsibility may include but not limited to

  • Design, build, and maintain sophisticated production systems in AWS to ensure the system's scalability, reliability, and efficiency.
  • Write and test high quality Python code that will run in a production environment. Familiarity with standard Python libraries.
  • Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve issues in our DevOps architecture, implementing preventative measures to reduce recurrence.
  • Develop and implement data analytics and machine learning applications to optimize our systems and inform decision-making, eg. better detect and understand driving actions, driver intent, forecasting driver behavior.
  • Document and manage all system operations to maintain transparency and easy reference for team members.
  • Building models and developing algorithms to support new key initiatives, eg. better detect and understand driving actions, driver intent, forecasting driver behavior
  • Data mining and cleaning
  • Interpret and disseminate information via reports
  • Researching and prototyping new technologies and methods that are relevant to the team’s initiatives
  • Providing business stake holders with relevant telematics data and findings in a useable format
  • Comfortable working in Linux or MacOS environment

Personal Attributes and Skills

  • Self-starter
  • Optimistic – change the world mentality
  • Fixer attitude
  • Drive to learn new skills and concepts
  • Able to handle multiple complex projects simultaneously
  • Programming experience in Python (preferred)
  • Familiarity with continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD), infrastructure-as-code (IaC), and other DevOps principles.
  • Visualization tools and packages (eg. Seaborn, dash, plot.ly)
  • Working knowledge of SQL
  • Prior experience in data science, with a focus on analytics and machine learning application development.

Knowledge

  • Familiarity with machine learning packages i.e. Tensor flow, Keras, FastAI
  • GIS experience is advantageous
  • Understanding of statistics and familiarity with statistical computing packages (eg. Scipy, numpy)
  • Modern machine learning techniques, in particular working time series data, device data and natural language processing
  • Algorithm analysis and code optimization
  • Understanding of techniques required to work with extremely large datasets (larger than RAM)
  • Ability to work with both structured and unstructured data, and ability to combine data from diverse sources
  • Experience with the Python data science stack is advantageous (numpy, pandas, jupyter, scipy, etc)

Education

  • Matric
  • Masters or Honours in one of the following fields: Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, or similar.

Experience

  • Solid experience (3+ years) in a Data Science / DevOps role, with demonstrated skills in Linux and the AWS ecosystem 2+ years Research experience – ESS
  • Strong statistics and analytical skills
  • Prior programming experience required

EMPLOYMENT EQUITY

The Company’s approved Employment Equity Plan and Targets will be considered as part of the recruitment process. As an Equal Opportunities employer, we actively encourage and welcome people with various disabilities to apply.

Job Type: Full Time
Job Location: South Africa

Who We Need – Business Intelligence Consultant



We are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Developer to join our Data, Information, and Analytics team as a client-facing, permanently employed consultant. Good communication and collaboration skills are therefore a must, as well as great technical ability, statistical ability, and a passion to convert data into thought provoking visual information. There will be exposure to a wide range of industries, so the ability to quickly understand new business environments is essential.




Who are we?


Decision Inc. is a management and technology consulting organization. The Company’s foundation is built in technology; however, what makes us unique is our understanding of how to unleash the potential locked in our clients’ business and their people. We help companies to run better, grow faster and change what they do.
We represent the following leading global technology brands and are experts in the implementation, support and execution of these technologies: SAP, QlikView, Microsoft, Alteryx and Adaptive Insights.

See more about our exciting fast-paced culture: Careers at Decision Inc.


What Will You Do?


Key Responsibility:



  • Identify and develop cutting edge and innovative technology solutions to enable better decision making for our customers
  • Participate in analysis and design sessions – work with business analysts to determine the best fit solution for our clients
  • Understanding of defined business and user requirements and ability to migrate requirements to any/all of the following solutions: Qlik, Tableau or PowerBI
  • Ability to understand the challenge and find solutions within the BI environment including extensions
  • Deliver the complete BI solution with the consulting team
  • Delve for insights in client data and processes to help improve their businesses
  • Communicate progress with client and project teams
  • Produce technical and user documentation
  • Data warehouse and ETL development and maintenance
  • Design, development and implementation of reporting and dash boarding
  • Implementation of specifications, from provided specifications and customer requirements
  • Data Staging and general support relative to Reports, Cube and Data Warehouse
  • Creating and maintaining detailed documentation for processes and procedures required


Who Do You Need to Be?



  • Relevant Degree e.g. Computer Science, Information Systems
  • At least 3-5 years’ experience
  • Must be in possession of a valid driver’s license
  • Microsoft or QlikView Certified (advantageous)
  • Experienced in either Qlik / Microsoft BI stack/ Tableau / Alteryx or general ETL tools
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Experience in data integration (script writing)
  • Data model designing (Back End design)
  • Experience in Application Integration (Front End)
  • Experienced in implementing BI tools for requirements and utilizing various sources
  • Consulting experience
  • The willingness to be cross-skilled into multiple other BI tools
  • Good understanding of data warehousing and analytical methodologies and solution delivery
  • Strong problem solving skills and good communication skills, both written and verbal – Explaining technical concepts to business people in a language they understand, and business requirements to technical people
  • Ability to work within a team and effective planning and organizational skills
  • Eagerness and willingness to learn – a positive attitude is everything!

Description
At Indie, we’re building world-class financial products for a mobile-native generation. We’re on a mission to help people navigate their way to financial freedom one step at a time.
Indie looks, feels and works like a scale-up, but has the backing and expertise of a leading South African insurance and investment giant - Sanlam. The Indie team is full of creative, collaborative people who think big, execute quickly and don’t take themselves too seriously. We’re building a diverse team of curious and creative people who want to find purpose in their work. If that sounds like you, we might be just the right fit.
Indie has an in-house creative and media team that looks after the full scope of our own marketing efforts. You will work closely with a team of art directors, digital/multimedia designers, copywriters and paid media specialists.
We’re looking for a Senior Growth Marketer to help track, test, analyse and optimise our marketing efforts and digital sales processes in order to drive revenue in a high-growth environment. What will make you successful in this role?

Responsibilities
Build and drive the growth strategy across our owned channels (website, CRM, organic social) to optimise the digital user journey.
Use data to define success for our digital acquisition funnel, to optimise funnel performance and drive revenue growth.
Work collaboratively with our Product, Engineering, Data, Digital Sales and Marketing teams to implement growth strategies across the digital customer journey.
Measure and report on the success of the digital sales funnel by building on our existing reporting structure and frameworks.
Understanding our customers and their behaviour across the full customer journey, from performance marketing through to acquisition.
Own and drive projects to maximise growth and revenue across multiple digital touchpoints.
Strong experience using data to implement and inform a test-and-learn approach to optimisation of our digital assets.

Our Ideal Candidate
7+ years experience in digital marketing, with at least 3 years spent in a growth function within an eCommerce business, with FinTech being highly beneficial.
Proven experience in generating revenue through optimisation of digital funnels across the entire digital customer journey - acquisition and retention.
Expert in Google Marketing Platform: Analytics 360, Tag Manager, Optimize, Data Studio, BigQuery.
Ability to design A/B tests and interpret results using testing tools like Google Optimize to recommend next steps to Business Owners.
Ability to analyse and present complex data to various stakeholder levels.
Highly organised, with excellent attention to detail.
An astute problem solver, with well-developed quantitative and analytical skills.
A self-starter who thrives in a high-energy, high-growth environment. Personal Attributes Business insight - Contributing through others Communicates effectively - Contributing through others Manages complexity - Contributing through others Plans and aligns - Contributing through others Action orientated - Contributing independently Being resilient - Contributing independently Collaborates - Contributing dependently Cultivates innovation - Contributing through others Demonstrates self-awareness - Contributing dependently Build a successful career with us
We’re all about building strong, lasting relationships with our employees. We know that you have hopes for your future – your career, your personal development and of achieving great things. We pride ourselves in helping our employees to realise their worth. Through its four business clusters – Sanlam Life and Savings, Sanlam Investment Group, Sanlam Emerging Markets, Santam, as well as MiWay and the Group Office – the group provides many opportunities for growth and development. he Sanlam Group is committed to achieving transformation and embraces diversity. display_title: Lead Data Engineer - CIB Data Enablement
job_description:
Bring your possibility to life! Define your career with us
With over 100 years of rich history and strongly positioned as a local bank with regional and international expertise, a career with our family offers the opportunity to be part of this exciting growth journey, to reset our future and shape our destiny as a proudly African group.

The CIB Data Enablement team within CIB Transactional Banking Tech is looking for a Lead Data Engineer.

Diane Schmucking

    • Ability to manipulate and manage large amounts of data, such as crowd-sourced network data, (e.g., in Excel, PowerBI, Oracle Analytics) to render the information visually simple and comprehensible; coupled with the ability to use software tools like Microsoft Office, Google Big Query, GIS tools and programming languages (like SQL, Python and R).
Duties
Insights, analytics, and business intelligence
  • Ensures that the latest crowd-sourcing, population and other data are regularly uploaded into the systems and tools, (such as the DataLake).
Business performance metrics
  • Monitors and maintains reporting to track and monitor the KPIs, thus enabling the tracking of business performance at regular (quarterly) strategy reviews
Reporting strategy execution
  • Ensures standards/methods are applied for consistent reporting within the organisation.
  • Ensures the provision of quality BI and insights to improve the value of the organisations reports.
  • Ensures a central repository is maintained, with guidelines on how to store and save the reports for consistency and for easy access, as part of a holistic knowledge management capability.
  • For example, provides guidelines for the Oracle reporting platforms, such as the way the directories are set up and categorised; the naming conventions; how to minimise the duplication of folders and reports; how to create consistency; and the accessibility of the reports.
  • Assists other departments in creating simple reports to enhance their ability to gain insights and access to information to enable better decision making.
  • Provides knowledge sharing on building reporting across the organization enabling specific users to build their own reports to the standard set.

Data management and data governance strategy
  • Works with the regional data governance team and departments to identify and agree key/critical data that must be maintained according to agreed standards.
  • Communicates and explains why the identified data fields are critical and the priority for cleaning the data, as well as the use case of those data fields.
  • Ensures clear data ownership across the business, as well as measurement of data accuracy, by providing guidelines, standards, tools and templates.
  • Works with the Systems and Business Process Manager (SBPM) and the process owners and data owners to look at ways to put process(es) in place to clean the data and maintain good data quality.
  • Builds reporting, or supports the regional data governance teams, in creating reports to measure and track data quality and accuracy for the agreed critical data points.
  • Supports the integration of data warehouses and modelling capabilities.
  • Reports on quality of crowd-sourced data, when required


Please apply directly, by clicking on the apply button or visit

Our Client is a rapidly growing startup within the community of a well known Crypto Media Channel, dedicated to providing crypto education to a global audience. If you are a dedicated data professional with a passion for crypto education and the drive to shape the future of our industry, we would love to hear from you.

display_title: Analyst Manager - Media Insights & Analytics - Cape Town
job_description:
Description

Join our team as the Manager of Media Insights & Analytics, where you will lead a group of talented analysts, guide their career development, and ensure the team's high-quality performance. As part of the management team, you will contribute to optimizing workflows, developing educational initiatives, and driving methodology innovation. Collaborating closely with internal teams, you will deliver valuable customer insights across various target market segments, platforms, and genres. We are seeking a people-oriented manager with exceptional soft skills and a proven track record of success.

About the Department: Global Delivery Services

Our Professional Services team at Meltwater is dedicated to curating bespoke reports and managing key projects for our prestigious clients. By analyzing diverse media outlets across traditional and social media channels, we provide essential business intelligence reports. Our team excels in adapting to clients' unique requirements and employs solution-oriented approaches, nurturing the development of each individual to their fullest potential.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Provide input on customer measurement infrastructure and requirements, ensuring alignment with research and analytics objectives.
  • Devise solutions to navigate legal and regulatory restrictions on market and customer data collection.
  • Develop comprehensive data analytics and market research plans aligned with business objectives.
  • Implement robust data quality control standards and methods.
  • Manage the team to meet schedules, budgets, and maintain high-quality output.
  • Collaborate with sales teams to identify and qualify business opportunities, accurately scoping and quoting projects.
  • Propose industry-leading media insights reports and deliverables in collaboration with cross-functional teams.
  • Analyze data sets, review reporting quality, and ensure timely delivery to clients.
  • Coordinate with various teams, external partners, and vendors for project execution.
  • Identify and forecast capacity requirements.

People Development & Management:

  • Participate in manpower planning, budgeting, and hiring processes.
  • Perform scheduling and rostering of team activities.
  • Attend leadership meetings for goal alignment and effective communication.
  • Conduct regular 1:1s with team members for check-ins and retention.
  • Oversee budgets, work allocations, and staffing.
  • Identify development areas and design tailored training pathways for team members.
  • Foster a culture of growth, accountability, and performance management.
  • Drive the overall culture and vision of the team, leading by example and nurturing team members' potential.

Requirements:

  • 3-4 years of experience as a team lead or manager, overseeing 4 or more individuals or leading a large project team.
  • Bachelor's degree in any field but Mathematics and/or Statistics modules or qualifications are preferred
  • Relevant industry experience in media insights/reporting & analytics, traditional or social media, media agencies & public relations, or digital marketing.
  • Experience working with Enterprise clients.
  • Proficiency in SaaS-based media tech platforms and media measurement KPIs.
  • Familiarity with statistical modeling, data mining techniques, and analytical tools and languages such as SQL, Python, R, etc. Although not mandatory, proficiency in these areas is preferred.
  • Skilled in data visualization and working with dashboard tools, as well as using Microsoft Excel and pivot tables for analysis.
  • Knowledge of research methodologies and proficiency in basic analysis methods.
  • Exceptional business level in spoken and written English.

Join our team and play a pivotal role in delivering exceptional media insights and analytics services to our clients. Be part of a dynamic and growth-oriented organization where your contributions are valued and your professional development is encouraged.

Apply now to become a part of the Meltwater journey!
