Company Description
-Join us at Mogalakwena as Month Scheduling Engineer. The purpose of this role is to develop and setup the three month (12 Weeks) mine schedule, in line with the budget targets (12 months plan), which can be used as output for execution in the week planning horizon.

Anglo Platinum

Guided by our purpose and our values, we enable both high performance and purposeful action as we aim to “re-imagine mining to improve people’s lives", delivering the metals and minerals that make modern life possible – from mobile phones to medicines.

Safety first is a way of life for us. We are unconditional about the safety, health, and well-being of our colleagues, at work and at home, and about that of the communities where we work. We aim to lead the industry by investing in innovation to protect people, who are at the heart of our business. Our high performing teams take accountability for their own and others' actions, work collaboratively, and always show care and respect.


Job Description
-Key responsibilities:

  • Ensure setup of the mine scheduling software is adequate to cater for the required detail for various stakeholders.
  • Ensure terms of reference adequate for inputs into month plans – liaise with different stakeholders to ensure to ensure all assumptions are covered.
  • Use and ensure latest information such as geology, design, blasting blocks for the setup of the mine scheduling models.
  • Do scenario runs with mine scheduling software to deliver the required production plan tonnages, quality, safety requirements – aligned with 12-month budget plan.
  • Include blending, ore flow (crushing and stockpiling) of different material types and classes in 3-month (12 Weeks) plan in scheduling software.
  • Identify and recommend opportunity to improve the short-term planning processes to minimize changes and maximize stability.
  • Create plans in accordance with the Mine Health and Safety Act and the Mine’s regulations that are within budget and directs mine production activities to achieve short-term targets.
  • Partake in reconciliation processes.
  • Undertake tasks as assigned pertaining to the implementation of the Anglo Operating Model in Operational Mine Planning

  • Qualifications
    -A relevant National Diploma in Mining or Degree in B.Eng. Mining/ B.Sc. Mining or other related fields.
  • Computer literacy and proficiency in mine scheduling software such as Deswik, Datamine, & Haulsim or other EPS applications
  • Driver’s Licence: Code B (Light Vehicle)

Experience:

  • 3-5 Years Open Pit operational experience in mine planning, scheduling, and related operations
  • Experience working with Deswik Packages: CAD, IS, Sched, LHS, Blend, Datamine & Haulsim
  • Experience and ability to communicate effectively.

This role is in the Mining Technical department at a Band 6 level reporting to the Section Manager Operational Mine Planning


Additional Information
-What we offer

When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Who we are.

Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine, process, move and market our products to our customers around the world.

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

How we are committed to your safety

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

How to apply

To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

  • Proficient in general accounting, closing & reporting
Duties include:
  • Ensuring SOP are adequately prepared/maintained and complied with
  • Identification of system weaknesses and recommendations for improvement identified and implemented
  • Managing cash flow and the treasury function of the entity
  • Preparation of cash flow forecast and budget, and providing overdraft requirements for the financial year
  • Ensuring the process for cash inflows and outflows are completed seamlessly
  • Review work of Treasury(Including Equipment Maintenance; Petty Cash controls; Tender Type Maintenance; and Receipt of Monies from stores)
  • Reconciliation of bank statement to SAGE GL and following up on variances
  • Review the bank reconciliations completed by the treasury clerks
  • Manage the split of functions between clerks
  • Review payments loaded, and authorise when payments can be submitted for release
  • Liaise with signatories and ensure all payments are released successfully
  • Managing new beneficiaries on the banking system
  • Petty cash control and safekeeping
  • Forex control and travel expenditure reconciled
  • Ensure optimal ROI is earned from excess cash
  • Review of budgets vs actual allocations
  • Preparing and publishing accurate and timely monthly management accounts
  • Driving the month end and year end closing process
  • Reconcile balance sheet accounts and review income statement account reconciliations
  • Review the general ledger for accuracy
  • Review and assist in preparation of individual entity monthly management packs
  • Review work of accountants
  • Assist with audit queries
  • Assist HOD in data analytics and marketing (Target Marketing)
  • Provide support to any ad hoc queries
Other Attributes:
  • Strong leadership skills
  • Critical thinking and problem solving skills
  • Effective communication skills
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Organizational, planning and analytical skills
  • Advanced Excel and Microsoft Office
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritise

Join us in shaping a more just world.
About Us
LexisNexis, a part of RELX, is a leading global provider of legal, regulatory, and business information. We help customers increase productivity and improve decision-making and outcomes. Our 10,500 experts and innovative tools help us shape a better world for our customers and communities.
About the Role
As a Legal Editor, you will be editing, converting, and publishing manuscripts onto our online platforms. Performing regular quality checks and updating platforms, you'll also assist in the development of new products.
Responsibilities
  • Proofreading and editing manuscripts according to specifications, ensure the content is accurate, relevant and of professional standard

Topco has an opening for a Digital Marketing Manager to join our team. Our hiring process is thorough but moves quickly for the right candidate.

Topco Media - "Inspire the world to do good business"

Top Media and Communications is the fastest growing business B2B digital media and events company in the country. We are looking for a motivated, growth-oriented leader to join our team.

Reporting to the Top Media Head of Marketing, the digital marketing and online lead generation campaign specialist is responsible for overseeing the transformation of our existing websites into a customer acquisition engine that customers love and competitors envy.

We are looking for an entrepreneurial leader that partners cross-functionally to enhance customer experience, drive acquisition and create a strategic digital vision and the road-map to achieve it.

Responsibilities

  • Drive customer acquisition using lead generation strategies and deliver tangible leads using latest lead generation tools
  • Ensure the company website is kept up-to-date and aligned with marketing objectives
  • Target-based lead generation and lead nurturing activities via content marketing, account-based marketing
  • Actively participate in overall marketing operations, lead management, and campaign execution to drive digital demand generation and paid media campaigns.
  • Act as a connection between the technology platforms, their capabilities and marketing goals, to advise best approach and drive execution and improvement over time.
  • Own the planning, quality assurance framework and execution of email and online marketing campaigns: this includes product, promotional and triggered email, content syndication, as well as, paid display, search and social advertising.
  • Develop, implement, and continuously evolve best practices for digital and email marketing across channels.
  • Develop and monitor campaign budgets.
  • Own end-to-end implementation and sending of email and digital marketing campaigns, including strategy, planning, segmentation, execution, testing, deployment, analysis and optimization.
  • Email marketing: Create and deploy regular email communications
  • Lead generation: Help to grow and maintain our lead generation strategy for sponsored campaigns
  • Plan, execute, and measure experiments and conversion tests
  • Create the strategy and lead the transformation of our online platforms to maximise revenue, including creating and implementing a multi-tier digital roadmap.
  • Optimise our digital customer experience journeys, offers and conversion points to drive customer engagement and revenue
  • Working across more than one brand


Qualifications:

  • A minimum of two to five+ years’ experience in a digital marketing or advertising
  • Experience in B2B marketing, particularly in marketing automation, website development, workflow - end to end journey social media platforms and SEM/SEO technologies and tools
  • An understanding of best practices related to website design, UX, organic and SEO
  • A strategic and entrepreneurial mindset who is comfortable crafting break through strategies in an ambiguous environment
  • Strong integrated marketing, communications and management skills including research, analytical skills, data, management and project management
  • Ability to manage complexity and coordinate across a number of departments while meeting tight deadlines
  • We take great pride in our inclusive culture. We value the different perspectives and unique skills you bring to the team – it makes us all better.
  • Apply today to be a part of a team environment where you can contribute, collaborate, and make a difference in the lives of people by adding value to a trusted network of companies.


Requirements

  • Online Lead Generation Campaign Specialist
    Expertise in lead funnel optimization and progression management.
  • Knowledge of SEO/SEM and Google Analytics.
  • Familiarity with analytical and database tools.
  • Familiarity with HubSpot.
  • Experienced with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
  • Ability to set up re-targeting ads/cookies within website
  • Must be able to work onsite
  • Good communication
  • Solution-based
  • Initiative-driven (self starter)


Comfortable working with programs like or similar to:

Hootsuite - Kajabi - Hubspot - CRM (salesforce and other) - Gsuite - Mailchimp/ Everletic -
Zoom - Hopin - Remo - Trello – Slack.

What we offer you

  • A working environment with plenty of creative freedom
  • A modern office in the heart of Cape Town
  • An open-minded, multinational team


Start: immediately | Location: Cape Town | Scope: full-time

Key purpose:

To be responsible for reviewing and analysing current business processes, systems, business logic and models in order to identify opportunities for optimisation and improvements which will positively impact clients experience.

﻿﻿Qualifications and experience:


  • Candidates straight from university will be considered.
  • 1-2 yrs experience in manufacturing, ideally responsible for process optimisation.
  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering - Industrial
  • Master's Degree in Engineering - Industrial or Business Administration
  • Demand and supply forecasting
  • S&OP (Sales and Operations Planning) and IBP (Integrated Business Planning)
  • Data analytics & data visualisation tools and techniques
  • Operational and decision-making models
  • Stakeholder engagement and relationship principles and practices
  • Demand and supply forecasting
  • S&OP (Sales and Operations Planning) and IBP (Integrated Business Planning)

﻿Required skills:

  • Commercial Thinking Skills
  • Computer Literacy (MS Word, MS Excel, MS Outlook)
  • Interpersonal & Relationship management Skills
  • Communications Skills
  • Numerical Reasoning skills
  • Facilitation Skills
  • Presentation Skills
  • SQL Skills
  • Planning, organizing and coordination skills
  • Analytical Skills
  • Problem solving skills
  • Attention to Detail
  • Reporting Skills
  • Influencing Skills

﻿Conditions of employment:

  • Clear criminal and credit record
  • A valid driver's license and own vehicle is required
  • Willingness to travel nationally on a regular basis

WHAT WE DO

Accenture’s Industry X is using the combined power of data and digital to help our clients reimagine the products they make and how they make them. Accenture serves more than 40 industries globally. We do more than advise — we build enduring, trust-based relationships with our clients, as we help them address their most complex problems. We are uniquely positioned to lead this tectonic market shift with our deep ecosystem of partners, including AWS, Dassault Systèmes, Google, Microsoft, PTC, SAP and Siemens

THE WORK

Join Accenture Industry X and you’ll help clients achieve greater productivity, drive growth and achieve their sustainability commitments. We do this by redefining not only how products are designed and engineered, sourced, supplied and manufactured but also driving circular practices every step of the way (from origin, to use, to renewal).

Be a leader in your field by applying your skills to completely reimagine how to meet customer demands, create new levels of productivity, inspire growth and champion sustainability. Our Consultants work together to deliver seamless outcomes to our clients, leveraging our complementary skillsets and industry expertise.

As an Analyst you will be involved in the following:

Identifying Opportunities: Assessing where the client is today, so we can identify ways to improve their business: gather, synthesise, visualise and analyse client information using research, interviews, workshops and analytic tools.

Defining Client Needs: Identifying and documenting business requirements, so that we and the client understand and agree on what needs to change and take advantage of new opportunities.

Designing the Future: Working with the client to design new business processes, technology requirements, and the plan for how we bring these changes to life using processes, technology and people.

Guiding our Clients: Defining how the client will evolve to the new stage—define the impact of the changes and the steps we will take to help the leaders, employees, customers and others adapt quickly to new ways of working.

What’s on offer for you:

Training & Development
Accenture offers exceptional development and career progression opportunities. We’ll invest in your development from your first day and ensure you have all the training you need to hit the ground running. We provide a structured, detailed and fun induction programme with our supportive graduate community. You can also look forward to mentorship from some of our most successful leaders.

Within your first year, you will get an opportunity to attend structured blocks of learning throughout the year, where you will further develop and enhance your skills. We encourage and facilitate for you to consistently develop your skills through frequent training sessions and our extensive, on-demand, learning platform.

Access Accenture’s 91 Connected Classrooms, 24,000+ Online Classes and 2,700+ Online Learning Boards, as well as

  • Industry X-Specific Learning Programs:

  • Foundational program

  • Role-based learning guidance

  • Ecosystem partner trainings & certification

  • Just-in-time learning programs

  • Activate Industry X Series, featuring subject matter experts and client stories

  • Industry X New Joiner learning program

Career Progression
Within our fast-growing Analyst groups, we aim to help each individual progress at the right pace for them. Every employee has a dedicated People Lead. Your People Lead will be a more senior colleague who will help you plan your career, training, and professional development, and advise you on a path to promotion, which is determined by individual performance and business needs.

Our Rewards & Benefits:

Accenture offers an attractive rewards package, which includes:
  • Competitive salary
  • 24 days annual leave
  • External study support and study leave
  • Medical Aid
  • Employee Share Purchase Plan; Accenture shares at a discount of up to 15%
  • Pension fund

We’re looking for well-rounded talented people with high learning agility and a >65% Grade Average.

Must be completing an Electrical/Electrionic, Mining, Metallurgical, Mechanical or Chemical Engineering bachelors degree from either UP, UCT, Wits or Stellenbosch.

Above that we look for people with intellectual curiosity and an entrepreneurial spirit, who can build relationships, lead others and who aren’t afraid to question the norm.

Set yourself apart by demonstrating the following skills and attributes:
  • Effective communication
  • Relationship building
  • Problem solving
  • Creativity
  • High learning agility
  • Adaptability
  • Taking initiative
  • Results-oriented

Responsibilities

Data Gathering:

  • Translate business objectives into research steps {{e.g., questionnaires, focus groups}}

  • Work cross-functionally to build relevant primary research collection tools for customers

  • Identify and collect relevant data points, for example:
    • Consumers: Demographics, buying habits, needs, and price points
    • Competitors: Pricing structures, current tactics, and sales channels

  • Construct and maintain a central database for recording market data. You will be expected to monitor the quality of the data, continually implement improvements, and train appropriate staff as necessary

  • Consistently exercise independent judgement and discretion in research matters

Analytics and Reporting:

  • Deploy statistical modeling techniques to analyze data and forecast future trends

  • Use integrity measures {{for example: null hypothesis testing}} to check quality of recorded data

  • Attend {{weekly sales meetings}} and present your research

  • Work with the teams to devise future commercial strategies based upon your findings

Skills and Requirements

  • Minimum of a bachelor’s degree, preferably within psychology, sociology, statistics, communications, or marketing

  • 2-5 years of direct experience within similar roles

  • Excellent IT skills across the Microsoft desktop suites and the following:
    • Statistical software packages: {{SPSS, SAS, R or Stata}}
    • Database manipulation {{SQL}} and CRM management
    • Advanced data visualization methods: {{Tableau, Business Objects}}

  • A natural curiosity and a “big picture” mentality

  • Excellent spoken and written communication and the tenacity to hold an argument

  • Ability to collaborate cross-functionally, with people of all levels

display_title: Supply Planning Lead: Biscuits, Meals & Imports SSA
job_description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible.

You will deliver on the medium- to long-term (9-12 months) forecast of material requirements to suppliers and activities related to mid- to long-term material requirements for assigned suppliers/materials across the region. You also track the contract coverage position and raise any new requisitions to procurement and identify risks and opportunities in medium-term material supply plans and drive dialogue and escalation.

How you will contribute

You will:

  • Develop short- and long-term materials planning for items produced internally and externally
  • Meet your KPIs including (but not limited to) raw/pack inventory levels, compliance to schedule (CTS), material write off
  • Perform root-cause analysis for continuous improvement of the plan
  • Maintain the integrity of system data and information for supply/materials planning
  • Partner with procurement for material optimization
  • Support and implement improvements in the planning arena to improve customer fill rate, inventory targets, and waste reduction to meet company KPIs

What you will bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:

  • Experience in FMCG/CPG environment, preferably food or other fast moving, dynamic industry where shelf life is a constraint
  • Experience in an IBP/S&OP environment
  • Able to influence cross-functional teams, working on the key priorities and improving the plan
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills – and able to understand and interpret data
  • Team player who can work with many other functions on a daily basis

More about this role

What you need to know about this position:

This is a highly dynamic role interfacing with our multiple plants and key stakeholders.

What you will bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:

· Materials, scheduling, supply chain and experience in a manufacturing FMCG business

· Supply planning experience (min 3-5 years proven) in a FMCG environment

· SAP APO planning experience, as well as SAP Supply Planning technical expertise

· Able to work under pressure and bring continuous improvement mindset

· Highly skilled at Problem-solving and analytics – able to understand and interpret data

· Work independently with high level of ownership

· Team player who can work with other functions daily

What extra ingredients you will bring:

· A can-do, winning attitude, with a desire for learning and growth

· CSCP (Certified Supply Chain Professional), CPIM (Certified Planning & Inventory Management) or similar degree would be advantageous

Education / Certifications:

Supply chain related education and certification

Travel requirements:

Limited

Work schedule:

40 hours

No Relocation support available

Business Unit Summary

Mondelez International’s Sub Sahara Africa BU is seen as the growth engine for the business. Currently, we operate out of two major hubs – South Africa, servicing south, central and east Africa; and Nigeria, looking after West Africa. Our product offering is as diverse and exciting as our over 2000 passionate people. We are category leaders in South Africa with our Cadbury chocolates; and our Bournvita product is a firm family favourite in Nigeria. We also delight our consumers with our candy offerings of Halls and Tom Toms; our Stimorol and Clorets gum and global favourite Oreo.
In all that we do, we will do business the right way – with our products, the environment and our communities.

Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Type

Regular

Supply Planning (MPS - scheduling - MRP)

Customer Service & Logistics

The Dialer Support Specialist is responsible for all aspects of the dialer strategies, campaign setup and prioritization, real-time monitoring, reporting, and analytics relating to dialer activities within the Customer Solutions Centre environment. The dialer support specialist must utilize the dialer and its capabilities to improve efficiency and performance and look for opportunities to improve productivity and conversions.

The role is also required to ensure associated system administration so that resources have access to the relevant telephony systems and accompanying campaigns to perform their functions.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Matric / Grade 12 or NQF level 4 equivalent

DESIRED/ PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Related Diploma/Degree very advantageous

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

  • 3 years minimum experience as a Dialler Administrator
  • Experience in managing multiple campaigns
  • Experiencing in working with data and producing analytical reporting
  • Experience in analysing reports and making productivity and/or effectiveness recommendations to management
  • Experience within a sales or financial services environment
  • Computer Literacy: MS Excel (intermediate – Advanced)
  • SQL Advantages
  • Experience in liaising with external service providers and 3rd party management

INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE

  • Sales Call Centre Industry experience.

DESIRED/ PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

Experience with the Five9 dialler solution

overview

An international Data Analytics company based in South Africa is looking for Senior Data Scientist to join their team.Our client is looking for a Senior Data Scientist who will collaborate across the various teams in the
solution designing in credit and non-credit industries, as well as development and deployment of solutions.

description

  • Developing advanced analytics and machine learning models for various industries
  • Developing advance analytical solutions to solve business problems for our clients
  • Developing predictive models and solutions across the credit life cycle for industries
  • Providing best practice consulting advice to a wide range of organisations that rely on data to drive their business, domestically and internationally
  • Offering day-to-day consulting assistance across multiple clients
  • Analysing reports and results while performing investigative analytics to solve problems
  • Compiling professional consulting reports and presentations for delivery to clients
  • Developing close relationships with clients to identify additional areas for development and assistance
  • Working in collaboration with other teams in the business such as sales, marketing, software deployment/development and consulting;
  • Driving and delivering new product innovation within the analytics team

experience, qualifications and skills

  • 8 – 10 years’ experience in consumer credit analytics, with specific focus on Predictive
    Modelling utilising Machine Learning methodologies and a proven track record
  • BComm majoring in Statistics; Quantitative Management OR a BSc Engineering; Mathematics; Applied Mathematics; Data Science; Logistics; or related fields
  • 8 – 10 years’ experience in consumer credit analytics, with specific focus on Predictive Modelling utilising Machine Learning methodologies and a proven track record
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
  • Good working knowledge of SQL, Python and Azure/AWS
  • High level of competence of Predictive Modelling techniques
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritise with a sense of urgency and work under pressure to tight deadlines
  • Demonstrate a thirst for knowledge and desire to grow and learn
  • Excellent customer service orientation
  • Strong presentation skills
  • An agile mindset and approach to work to improvise and adapt principles into alternative environments
  • Amazing Ms Excel skills, coupled with super skills in Ms Word and PowerPoint

Develop your own analytics and predictive solutions on Service Now platform.

Develop and operate custom AI NLP microservice application (BERT, SOLR, FAISS, flask, nginx).

Operate and maintain Splunk App for IT infrastructure analytics.

Operate and maintain own Splunk installation, incl. infrastructure.

Test and deploy your solutions with our agile toolchain.

No on-call duty required at this point.

Completed university degree in computer science, data science or similar.

Sound knowledge of at least three of the following: JavaScript, Python, XML/JSON, CSS.

Familiar with CI / CD and source code management (using GIT).

Knowledge of maintenance and operations of applications.

Experience in analyzing data, e. g. with Python libraries and Jupyter Notebook.

Between 3 - 5 Years

The Africa Assurance Innovation and Digital team is looking to hire a skilled manager to lead our Automation pillar for our Assurance business.

Automation Solutions address particular risk/pain point for the Assurance business using a range of smart technologies such as Robotic Process Automation (RPA), SharePoint, Machine Learning (ML), Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Data Analytics.

As the Africa Automation leader, you will look after all Global and EMEIA developed solutions and drive usage by our audit teams and provide support on these solutions. You will also be responsible for the design and development of Africa Assurance Automation and oversee a team of business analysts and full stack developers that will develop these automation solutions to solve a pain point experienced by our audit teams, and in certain cases the greater Assurance business.

Other responsibilities include:

Business Case Development

  • Provide input into the product vision and roadmap for Automation within assurance for Africa (13 countries included) by aligning to EY’S overall company strategy, commercial business unit requirements and key opportunities
  • Communicate vision and roadmap to stakeholders to ensure buy in, support and clarity on direction and execution
  • Collaborate with key business stakeholders to define requirements and establish priorities for the product team based on business objectives and strategy
  • Optimize and continuously improve the experience and the value derived from of the products, journeys and services delivered by the product team through ongoing analysis of customer feedback, user / journey analytics and innovation

Product development oversight

  • Participate in the conceptual solution design process to make recommendations to create and enhance solutions that are innovative, scalable, and sustainable and solve complex business problems.
  • Participate in User Acceptance testing and guide users to ensure that the designed solution ultimately meets business requirements.
  • Participate in the success/acceptance criteria definition using scenario testing and test cases to ensure that testing covers all aspects of the business specification.
  • Validate the functionality of all technical solutions in line with business requirements on completion of development to ensure that business requirements are met in the implemented solutions.


Quality Management

  • Ensure that projects are delivered within the agreed timelines and in accordance with agreed quality standards and comply with the EY Certification of solutions policy, data protection policy and Information security policies.
  • Consider and recommend enhancements for project performance and processes and initiate remedial action where defects are evident

Stakeholder Management

  • Be an active member of the EMEIA automation sounding board, which is a network set up across the EMIEA region where you are required to represent Africa, contribute automation ideas that are scalable to be deployed to the rest of EMEIA and also provide insight on how the Africa market is operating and track against automation usage KPIS that are set.
  • Report to Assurance Leadership monthly on the automation team’s performance, status of projects, report on automation savings per sector and cluster as measurement occurs at an African level.
  • Engage with audit teams and gather and interpret any requirements that they may have based on a pain pointe experienced on their audits that can be automated.
  • Provide insights on any new automations that may launch via communication with teams directly or through the Innovation and Digital Newsletter
  • Drive usage by providing key insights at Quarterly sector partner and manager connect sessions and Digital account planning sessions
  • Act as a liaison between key stakeholders such as audit technical and the quality enablement team to ensure that automation solutions that are being developed makes business sense and will either save our teams time or assist with an AQR or IRBA finding.

Budget Management

  • Prepare forecasts and budget for the Africa Assurance Innovation and Digital business unit in line with the overall division.
  • Manage and optimize the budget, ensuring all expenditure is in line with the agreed budgets for the Automation and Digital Solutions area.
  • Forecast what the automation savings will be for the Audit teams per solution, per country and sector and track monthly how automation targets are being met.

Skills and attributes

  • An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving.
  • Highly self-motivated and self-directed
  • Logical and efficient, with a keen attention to detail
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to communicate technical details to non-technical audiences
  • Excellent listening, interpersonal and oral communication skills
  • Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
  • Excellent planning, organisational, project and time management skills
  • Knowledge and interest in computer systems and the latest technologies


To qualify for the role, you must have

  • Bachelor’s degree in the fields of Accounting, Management, IT, IT Audit, Computer Science
  • Minimum 3-5 years of experience in the Audit / Accounting / Business environment
  • Minimum 2 years Management Experience - comfortable communicating with Junior Developers, Business Analysts and Project Managers.


  • Experience in effectively managing the Audit process with appropriate consideration of audit risk issues and accounting technical matters.
  • Basic knowledge and understanding of software development life cycle processes, agile development methodologies, software design and testing principles.
  • Basic knowledge and understanding of Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) and how it can be used with the audit process.

Advantageous not Mandatory

  • Demonstrate expertise in Primary accounting framework (IFRS) and related financial reporting matters.
  • Demonstrate expertise in using the EY audit methodology to perform an assurance engagement in compliance to the International Auditing standards.
  • Extensive knowledge of the International Auditing standards

DIGITAL MARKETING SPECIALIST


As a key role in the Demand Marketing team, the Digital Marketing Specialist will work closely with demand marketing managers and other marketing functions, with the ownership of planning, execution and reporting of digital activities, helping to increase growth and optimisation.


Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Oversee our digital marketing activity including the development and maintenance of Google AdWords/Display, LinkedIn Ads and Marketing Automation tool:

Google AdWords/Display:
  • Liaise with Portfolio Marketing team and SEO Managers to determine primary and secondary key words and regularly update the key word bank.
  • Collaborate with Demand Marketing Managers to regionalise / localise the key words and set up Google Ads accordingly.
  • Review and optimise the ads on regular basis to maximise the ROIs.
  • Provide regional/global performance reports of ads

LinkedIn Ads:
  • Oversee and maintain the Linked Ad calendar to manage the traffic.
  • Sanity check and launch the LinkedIn Ads created by the Demand Marketing Managers.
  • Review and optimise the ads on a weekly basis to maximise the ROIs.
  • Define, execute, analyse, and optimize A/B and multi-variant tests.
  • Provide regional/global performance reports of ads

Marketing Automation – Pardot
  • Liaise with external agency and in-house brand team to ensure templates are branded and optimised.
  • Create Pardot assets, including lists, forms, landing pages, emails, automation rules, engagement studios, etc.
  • Develop and execute email marketing campaigns based on that strategy - including the set-up, testing, scheduling, and deployment of one-time, recurring, and triggered campaigns
  • Perform ongoing A/B and other testing to improve campaign performance.
  • Regularly review Pardot assets and conduct cleansing when necessary.
  • Collaborate with the Marketing Operations team to improve data quality.
  • Collaborate with the Content Marketing team to ensure the integration of content across relevant digital channels.
  • Work with Marketing Analytics Managers to measure and report performance of digital marketing campaigns and assess critical metrics and ROIs on a monthly, quarterly & yearly basis


Skills Required:

  • A degree, or equivalent, ideally in Marketing or Business or another relevant field, or equivalent experience in a similar or related role(s).
  • 2+ years of experience in Digital Marketing or a similar position preferred
  • Good understanding & experience in of Digital Marketing (social media, Google Analytics, CRMs SEO/SEM, etc,)
  • Experience of formulating, leading and evaluating multi-channel digital marketing strategies.
  • A natural communicator, able to develop relationships with key stakeholders both within and outside of the marketing and comms team.
  • A problem solver, someone who finds solutions that support business objectives and has creative ideas on how to continuously improve the ROIs.
  • A strong understanding of cultural nuances and an authentic wish to align with the Group’s values and promote them across the region (We care, we promote respect, we are exceptional, we drive growth).
  • Ability to handle time-sensitive projects and working to deadlines.
  • Enjoy taking responsibility for multiple projects simultaneously and know how to keep yourself, and others around you, organised and focused on a plan.
  • Strong relationship building and negotiation skills to manage internal stakeholders and work at a fast pace with the rest of the marketing team.
  • Enjoy working with a diverse group of colleagues and stakeholders and the ability to work remotely from your colleagues and remain connected through regular calls and conversations.
  • A natural aptitude for collaboration and thrive on working in a high-pressure environment.
  • 1 year of experience with CRM and MAP tools - Salesforce and Pardot preferred.


What you will get in return:

  • A genuinely unique opportunity to be part of an expanding large global business.
  • The opportunity to own the marketing strategy for the North Asia and Oceania region and demonstrate your ability to help drive the business toward achieving its local revenue targets.
  • The chance to actually impact the business, be heard and implement your own ideas.

display_title: Strategic Information/ Monitoring, Evaluating and Learning Advisor
job_description:
Experience : 5-7 years
Panagora Group is a social enterprise dedicated to providing high-quality, high-impact international health, development, and learning consulting. We are a dynamic woman- and employee-owned small business partner focused on market-based and integrated local solutions that strengthen country capacity and independence; and on learning, communications, and technology solutions to accelerate and heighten impact. As a small business, we are able to implement novel and innovative approaches using highly participatory approaches to mobilize community, civil society, and government energy in defining and owning solutions, and to promote inclusive development that benefits all groups.


Position Summary

Background
The Technical Support Services (TSS) Activity helps USAID/Southern Africa and Regional Health Office (RHO) to address technical priorities and develop creative, innovative solutions to strategically allocate resources, strengthen connections with partners, and replicate best practices and effective program models. Through the TSS contract, Panagora Group augments capacity by providing technical, operational, and administrative support to USAID’s largest health portfolio. TSS deploys advisors in response to USAID requests for priority work with government stakeholders, implementing partners, and/or other entities. TSS supports Health Office staff and teams to integrate creative solutions into routine work. TSS also provides international and local expertise for surge support, as needed, for USAID Program Cycle requirements, planning, development, outreach, communications, and Health Office human resource functions.


Description of Position :
The USAID/Southern Africa Regional Health Office (RHO) based at USAID/Southern Africa in Pretoria seeks a Regional Strategic Information/ Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (SI/MEL) Advisor who will join RHO’s technical advisory services platform to advance the implementation of the U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) programs across the Southern Africa region. RHO has technical Advisors in HIV Care and Treatment; TB; OVC and HIV Prevention in Adolescent and Young Women; Digital Health; primary health care and integrated service provision; and in Localization and Sustainability. The SI/MEL Advisor plays a lead role in strengthening the RHO technical advisory services platform through advancing PEPFAR strategic information and monitoring, evaluation, and learning approaches across the USAID Southern Africa region .


The SI/MEL Advisor drives regional data analytic initiatives and provides country specific support to PEPFAR monitoring and evaluation activities and strategic information teams, when called upon, especially during peak work cycles such as during preparation and submission of the Country Operational Plans (COPs) and during quarterly program performance reporting cycles. S/he engages in all aspects of data analyses for effective program planning, including assistance with UNAIDS EPP/Spectrum modeled estimates; assisting with routine program performance reporting, including quarterly, semi-annual, and annual PEPFAR reports, portfolio reviews; assistance with surveillance studies, Demographic Health Surveys (DHS) PHIAs, size-estimations, and other special studies.


Under the supervision of RHO’s Team Lead for Program Analytics, or his/her designate, the major duties and responsibilities for this position will include but not be limited to:


Strategic Information Support to USAID Missions teams (50%)

  • Lead quarterly, semi-annual, and annual performance reports to understand USAID/PEPFAR program performance across the region.
  • Provide strategic information support to USAID Missions and host country stakeholders in the region across program planning and implementation cycles.
  • Provide guidance and support to USAID/PEPFAR implementing partners and government counterparts to develop and implement program monitoring, evaluation, and learning plans
  • Strengthen the cap acity of USAID/PEPFAR implementing partners and government counterparts in using data to inform policy and programmatic decisions.
  • Provide guidance and support to USAID/PEPFAR implementing partners in the development and implementation of program/project/activity Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning Plans
  • Advise USAID Missions teams on specific measurement techniques appropriate for their programs/projects/activities, including reviewing partner activity work plans and monitoring plans to ensure relevant and effective performance measures, and defining indicators that appropriately measure anticipated outcomes and results.
  • Assist in the development, implementation, and analysis related to special studies, surveys, and surveillance activities, including both qualitative and quantitative studies, such as demographic health surveys (DHS), population-based HIV impact assessments (PHIAs), violence against children surveys (VACS), Integrated HIV Bio-behavioral surveillance survey (IBBS), etc.
  • Work with country SI leads to ensure that survey and surveillance findings and performance data are integrated into program decision-making and partner work plans.
  • Provide mentorship to RHO technical staff and RHO client country staff on MEL concepts, processes, and design, including novel analytical approaches to advance data use for decision making.

Regional Leadership and Knowledge Management (35%)

  • Develop data-driven products, requiring independent analysis and interpretation on regional health outcomes for informational, advocacy, and coordination purposes; prepare visually compelling briefs and presentations with findings and recommendations.
  • Develop effective implementation approaches to institutionalize high quality monitoring, evaluation, and reporting across RHO client countries in the region.
  • Facilitate knowledge sharing and transfer across regional program and strategic information teams to improve analytic approaches, facilitate uptake of best practices, and inform new strategies.
  • Identify and disseminate best practices in data visualization and data storytelling.
  • Represent USAID, as appropriate , on relevant technical working groups and in technical discussions on issues related to strategic information approaches.
  • Organize and share epidemiological and programmatic data, analyses, and tools with USG partners and other international organizations in the region e.g.: UNAIDS, Global Fund, International Organization for Migration (IOM).
  • Perform other duties as assigned by the RHO Director and/or RHO Deputy Director.

Collaboration and Continuous Learning (15%)

  • Maintain effective working relationships with colleagues in USAID Global Health Bureau’s Office of HIV/AIDS (OHA’s) Strategic Information Evaluation and Informatics (SIEI) division, as well as RHO client country SI teams to keep abreast of evolving SI related needs across USAID programs.
  • Keep abreast of current public health literature, reports, international guidelines, standards, and best practices; Attend courses, seminars, conferences, or participate in other learning and professional development opportunities related to the core job function and needed to maintain and update professional knowledge.
  • Attend and/or present at regional meetings, conferences on SI, epidemiology, and other relevant topics.
  • Work closely with relevant regional multilateral and bilateral stakeholders to identify opportunities for collaboration and coordination of strategic information activities at the regional level.
  • Other activities as assigned.



Requirements

Qualifications:

  • A Master’s degree in a social science e.g.: Epidemiology, Public Health, Public Health Informatics, Statistics, mathematics,
  • I n-depth , professional-level knowledge of methods for performance analysis, data visualization, and program design, monitoring, and evaluation required .
  • A dvanced quantitative and qualitative data management and data-analysis skills, and advanced knowledge of MS Excel and applications such as, DATIM/DHIS2, Stata or SPSS or SAS or R, EPP/Spectrum, ArcGIS and Tableau required .
  • Knowledge of principles, theories, methods, and procedures of statistical analysis and research design, related to epidemiology and biostatistics.
  • Exceptional Data storytelling skills, including the ability to develop a compelling narrative based on complex data and analytics to help tell, influence or inform a particular audience.
  • Able to communicate effectively, both verbally and visually, to high level decision-makers on technical matters, including topics that may be outside of his/her area of expertise.
  • F amiliarity with program monitoring and reporting in resource-poor environments with varying levels of health information systems maturity required .
  • Demonstrate understanding PEPFAR monitoring and evaluation and reporting (MER) guidance, including ability to exercise considerable ingenuity in applying new and evolving reporting guidelines and novel analytical approaches across different settings.
  • Demonstrate ability to resolve problems that arise by determining the approaches and methodologies to be used, and to make defensible judgments under such circumstances.
  • Able to provide technical advisory services and technical assistance to USAID Operating Units on PEPFAR SI practices, including completion of various operational planning and reporting tools, such as the FAST, End of Fiscal Year reporting, Facts Info, and PEPFAR Next Gen tools, as well as implementation and analysis of Data Quality Assessment (DQA) Methodologies and Site Inspection and Monitoring Systems (SIMS).
  • Demonstrate leadership and coordination skills, including ability to deal effectively and diplomatically with a variety of stakeholders, including multiple U.S. government agencies, implementing partners (IPs) - international and local - multilateral organizations, and other donors.
  • Familiarity with USAID program/project management cycles to assist with program design, implementation, and the achievement of results in the course of providing technical assistance .
  • Understanding of development problems in the health sector in the region.
  • Ab le to respond professionally and adjust in fluid situations to meet deadlines in the face of competing priorities and time pressures.
  • Able to travel regularly (up to 60% LOE) within the southern Africa region and beyond, as required.
  • Excellent verbal and written English language skills.
  • Proven capacity to take the initiative and willingness to learn new skills as needed.
  • Strong work ethic and the ability to work well independently and as part of a multidisciplinary, culturally diverse team.

Work Experience:

  • Five years of progressively responsible job-related professional-level experience in monitoring, evaluation, and learning (MEL) and other surveillance systems, evaluation of program/project/activity implementation, in direct program/project/activity management, or in a closely related activity is required . At least two years of this experience in a development-oriented workplace, or a related field, for USAID, other donor agencies, host-country organizations, or private-sector institutions, which included project design, performance monitoring, and/or the analysis and interpretation of large amounts of data, is required .
  • Proven experience with data collection, analyses, and reporting, including project management experience related to conceptualization and design of complex data-related activities and initiatives.
  • Demonstrated experience working with clients on executing complex projects that involve data collection, data cleaning/wrangling, and analysis, including improving client’s ability to use, present, analyze, and communicate with data.
  • Demonstrated experience in interpreting research and evaluations for a wide audience, and effectively applying and translating findings into effective practice.
  • Experience exercising a high degree of judgment in providing guidance and assistance to a wide variety of high-level professionals, including ability to independently plan, prioritize, and carry out context specific activities and deliverables.
  • Demonstrated experience in technical and strategic information needs related to USAID’s development programs and approaches, preferably related to HIV/AIDS prevention, care, and treatment in sub-Saharan Africa.
  • Demonstrated experience in building and maintaining effective relationships, building consensus within diverse teams, and fostering cooperation among constituents with diverse viewpoints and perspectives.

No telephone inquiries, please. Finalists will be contacted. Please include a cover letter and resume. Only applicants who include the required application components will be considered.

  • Note: Panagora does not offer visa sponsorship.

Master's Degree

Key Responsibilities:


  • Define, own and lead the Employment Equity imperatives in close partnership and collaboration with Directors, Management and HR Practitioner in line with overall group EE Strategy.
  • EE related consultations and implementation initiatives to drive and support attainment of EE Strategy and Targets.
  • Keep track of engagements in accordance with EEA and EE Strategy.
  • Legislated forum meetings: Preparation of EE reports in EEA formats including leading meetings of annual EE Annual submissions with Skills Development Manager, HR Managers and HR Director.
  • Perform operational duties to fulfil EEA requirements of reporting, analysis, insights, and Functional Targets.
  • Continuously review and improve our EE processes by undertaking regular reviews and assisting in reviews, administrative systems, and procedures.
  • Ensure the accuracy of information by regularly conducting checks and sample audits as appropriate.
  • Liaising and partnering with HR Practitioners on development plans to support, impact and drive the success of our EE targets and strategy.
  • Tracking employee development for EE purposes and workplace profile statistics.
  • Custodianship of EE data in accordance with the EEA.
  • Tracking employee movements and workplace profile statistics.
  • Ensuring reconciliation of data with various systems for accuracy.
  • Advising and influencing functional Directors of EE status and gaps.
  • Manage relationships with Department of Labour by Reporting, keeping abreast of new developments, advising, and partnering with business and implementing new requirements.
  • To be fully aware of reward practices of direct and indirect competitors and market practice and share knowledge as appropriate.
  • Support the Talent Management and Succession Planning, Organization Design and Development insights and analytics throughout the group.

Required Skills and Experience:

  • Experience in an HR Generalist or Specialist role.
  • 5+ years plus experience working in an Employment Equity and Skills Development role.
  • Expert knowledge and application of the Employment Equity Act and advantageous to have demonstrated experience in, BBB-EE Act, BBB-EE Codes of Good Practice.
  • Experience with the driving Diversity and Inclusion Initiatives in support of EE in the workplace.
  • Understand the EE, LRA, BCEA, SDA and SDLA legislation.
  • Compilation of business employment equity targets and reports.
  • Strong analytical ability: comfortable with metrics and able to drive others towards data driven decisions.
  • Project or program management experience- Strong IT literacy with good MS Excel, MS Word and MS Power Point skills.
  • Strong exposure to systems and reporting.
  • Demonstrated Experience in implementing Employment Equity Strategies aligned to Business Imperatives.
  • Relationship skills across leadership levels within the organisation.
  • Adaptable and flexible solution-based thinking.
  • Highly numerate and Advanced Excel skills - comfortable with financial data.

Technical / Professional Qualifications:

  • Educated to at least first-degree level (or equivalent)
  • HR / Industrial Psychology Degree or equivalent 3-year HR Qualification.
  • Experience as and EE practitioner.

:

Reporting directly to the CEO, the Executive Assistant provides executive support in a one-on-one working relationship. The Executive Assistant serves as the primary point of contact for internal and external customers on all matters pertaining to the executive office.

Working under general direction, performs a variety of complex, highly responsible, sensitive and confidential office, administrative and secretarial support functions for CEO, Executive Leadership and other stakeholders; and performs related duties as assigned.

The Executive Assistant must be creative and enjoy working within a retail environment that is mission-driven, results-driven and customer centric. The ideal individual will have the ability to exercise good judgment in a variety of situations, with strong written and verbal communication, administrative, and organizational skills, and the ability to maintain a realistic balance among multiple priorities. The Executive Assistant will have the ability to work independently on projects, from conception to completion, and must be able to work under pressure at times to handle a wide variety of activities and confidential matters with discretion.

Key Responsibilities

Executive Support to the CEO

  • Completes a broad variety of administrative tasks for the CEO including: managing an extremely active calendar of appointments; completing expense reports; composing and preparing correspondence that is sometimes confidential; arranging complex and detailed travel plans, itineraries, and agendas; and compiling documents for travel-related meetings.
  • Plans, coordinates and ensures the CEO’s schedule is followed and respected. Provides “gatekeeper” and “gateway” role, creating win-win situations for direct access to the CEO’s time and office.
  • Researches, prioritizes, and follows up on incoming issues and concerns addressed to the CEO, including those of a sensitive or confidential nature. Determines appropriate course of action, referral, or response.
  • Provides a bridge for smooth communication between the
  • CEO’s office and internal departments; demonstrating leadership to maintain credibility, trust and support with all employees.
  • Works closely and effectively with the CEO to keep him/her well informed of upcoming commitments and responsibilities, following up appropriately. Acts as a “barometer,” having a sense for the issues taking place in the environment and keeping the CEO updated.
  • Provides leadership to build relationships crucial to the success of the organisation, and manages a variety of special projects for the CEO, some of which may have organisational impact.
  • Successfully completes critical aspects of deliverables with a hands-on approach, including drafting acknowledgement letters, personal correspondence, and other tasks that facilitate the CEO’s ability to effectively lead the company.
  • Prioritizes conflicting needs; handles matters expeditiously, proactively, and follows-through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline pressures.
  • Handles information of a highly confidential and critical nature on a regular basis, including the orchestration of reports and data analytics.
  • Takes initial steps to facilitate the resolution of urgent/complex issues and notifies the CEO timeously.
  • Foster positive relationships while interacting with employees and various levels of management from within and outside of the organisation to provide or gather information often of a sensitive and timely nature.
  • Build strong relationships within the organisation to ensure efficient and effective collaboration fostering an atmosphere of engagement, as well as with administrative assistants of other management team members to ensure a high performance, customer service-oriented work environment.
  • Interpret policies, procedures, laws and regulations in response to inquiries and complaints; refer inquires as appropriate.

Board Support and Executive Leadership:

  • Assists board members with travel arrangements, lodging, and meal planning as needed.
  • Maintains discretion and confidentiality in relationships with all board members.
  • Adhere to compliance with applicable rules and regulations set in bylaws regarding board and board committee matters, including advance distribution of materials before meetings in electronic/paper format.
  • Serves as the primary point of contact for internal and external customers on all matters pertaining to the executive office.
  • Acts as confidential executive assistant to the Clerk of the Board and Executive Leadership; provides a wide variety of clerical and administrative support; resolve concerns and complaints in a timely and accurate manner; follow up with employees as necessary for detailed information to be included in response.
  • Assists in the implementation and follow-up on Board decisions and requests as directed by the Clerk of the Board.
  • Gathers and analyses data on a variety of administrative and policy matters; develops recommendations and prepares and presents related reports.
  • Provides administrative support to the executive leadership and members of the leadership team. Some areas may include: scheduling meetings, maintain and update executives’ daily calendar, managing incoming and outgoing phone calls, drafting correspondence, creating spreadsheets and presentations, preparation of expense reports, mailing or overnighting letters/packages, establishing and maintaining electronic and paper files, copying, etc.
  • Acts as a “gate-keeper” by managing the executive leadership’s calendars. This involves using discretion in identifying critical items, setting up meetings and making scheduling changes with minimal involvement by the executive leadership. Plans, coordinates and ensures the executive leadership’s schedule is followed and respected. Provides “gatekeeper” and “gateway” role, creating win-win situations for direct access to the executive leadership’s time and office.
  • Arranges travel, hotel accommodations, and meeting planning as necessary for the executive leadership and as well as other members of the team as applicable.

Internal Communication & Employer Brand Strategy

  • Provides a bridge for smooth communication between the executive office and internal departments; demonstrating leadership to maintain credibility, trust and support with senior management.
  • Serve as recording secretary to internal committees (Data Management/Records Committees), schedule meetings, prepare agenda and take minutes.
  • Ensures materials and reports for signature are accurate and complete; proofreads and checks typed and other materials for accuracy, completeness and compliance with company standards, policies and procedures.
  • Oversees the development and implementation of communication campaigns which support key business / strategic objectives and organisational change strategy.
  • Encourages best practice in internal communications through benchmarking and other research.

Functional Competencies:

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and Power Point), Adobe Acrobat, and Social Media web platforms.
  • Strong organizational skills that reflect ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with excellent attention to detail.
  • Expert level written and verbal communication skills.
  • Manage multiple and rapidly changing priorities to meet the needs and expectations of elected and appointed officials and executives.
  • Ability to anticipate executive needs and collect or prepare information for executive review and action is required.
  • Valid Driver’s license.

Behavioural Competencies

  • Maintain confidentiality and operate with poise and professionalism in a complex, high-profile, and rapidly changing environment.
  • Very strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with stakeholders, including employees, board members and external partners.
  • Demonstrated proactive approaches to problem-solving with strong decision-making capability.
  • Friendly, team player with emotional maturity and a can-do attitude.
  • Highly resourceful team-player, with the ability to also be extremely effective independently
  • Proven ability to handle confidential information with discretion, be adaptable to various competing demands, and demonstrate the highest level of customer/client service and response.
  • Demonstrated ability to achieve high performance goals and meet deadlines in a fast paced environment.
  • Forward looking thinker, who actively seeks opportunities and proposes solutions.
  • Confident, Decisive, Strong leadership skills, and ability to grow and learn.
  • Adhering to principles and Values.

Qualification

  • Bachelor’s business degree
  • Experience and interest in internal and external communications.

Experience

  • Strong work tenure: 5 to 10 years of experience supporting C-Level Executives, preferably in a retail environment.

Data Engineering Analytics Lead

IT – Analyst, Data Management
Pretoria/Centurion – Gauteng

ENVIRONMENT:
A leading global Digital Solutions Tech company is seeking a Data Engineering & Analytics vertical market lead who will be responsible for providing advisory and thought leadership on the provision of analytics environments leveraging Cloud based platforms, big data technologies, including integration with existing data and analytics platforms and tools. You will drive pre-sales (proactive, reactive pursuits). Come up with solutions for scalable data architectures, and information solutions covering data security, data privacy, data governance, metadata management, multi-tenancy, and mixed workload management, implement projects and provide delivery oversight.
You will lead multiple competencies within data engineering & analytics, guiding communities on the next best technologies and helping them plan the next set of solutions and services in their respective technologies to present to customers.
DUTIES:
Data Engineering & Analytics Lead at the company takes up end to end ownerships of pre-sales, service offerings, external & internal communications, projects and provide valuable inputs to define strategies. You will do this by:
  • Responding to client RFI, RFP documents with proper solution design including cost estimates
  • Understanding customer requirements and create technical proposition.
  • Creating proactive proposals by understanding customer business priorities, and technology landscape
  • Contributing to SoWs, technical project roadmaps, etc required for successful execution of projects leveraging Technical Scoping & Solutioning approach.
  • Building Solution roadmap & strategy for internal DE&A platform
  • Leading analyst briefings and presentations
  • Managing all aspects of technical solutions development and ensure successful project deliveries.
  • Developing best practises as & when needed
  • Estimating effort, identifying risk and providing technical support whenever needed
  • Demonstrating the ability to multitask and re prioritizing responsibility based on dynamic requirements.
  • Leading and mentoring various practice competency practice teams as needed
REQUIREMENTS:
  • 15-20 Years of Data and Analytics experience with minimum 5+ years in one of cloud platforms like Azure, AWS or GCP Cloud native data services.
  • Experience working on cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google Cloud).
  • Expertise in Snowflake, Databricks, Big Query, Synapse.
  • Experience with the Big Data stack (HDFS, SPARK, MapReduce, Hadoop, Sqoop, Pig, Hive, HBase, Flume, Kafka) as well as with the No-SQL (e.g., MongoDB, HBase, Cassandra).
  • Experience with related/complementary open-source software platforms and languages (e.g., Java, Python, Scala)
  • Good understanding of AI, ML implementation life cycle, latest tools, and offerings.
  • Working experience with ETL (Extract-Transform-Load) tools (e.g., Informatica, Talend, Ab Initio, Pentaho)
  • Experience working with various data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Oracle Analytics Cloud etc.).
  • Analytical and consulting skills.
  • Working within a project management/agile delivery methodology in a leading role as part of a wider team.
ATTRIBUTES:
  • Strong written, verbal, and presentation communication skills.
  • Be able to work with customers independently.
  • Excellent communication skills interviewing, preparation and delivery of presentations and reports.

Company Description


WNS (Holdings) Limited (NYSE: WNS) is a global Business Process Management (BPM) leader. WNS offers business value to 400+ global clients by combining operational excellence with deep domain expertise in key industry verticals, including Banking and Financial Services, Consulting and Professional Services, Healthcare, Insurance, Manufacturing, Retail and Consumer Packaged Goods, Shipping and Logistics, Telecommunications, Travel and Utilities.

WNS South Africa has been in operation since 2003 and built a reputation as the industry leader for Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) in South Africa, with a growing footprint into Africa. We are a strategic partner for delivering a full range of basic to complex processes from our eight delivery centers across South Africa, employing 4000+ people.

Why join us?

We promise our employees to experience role clarity, coaching and mentoring, professional development and structured career path through our 5 people promises and keeping employee experience at the core. Experience the culture of outperformance, engagement, celebration and also contribute to society through our WNS Cares Foundation, where you have the opportunity to support meaningful initiatives and make an impact in the community.


Job Description


To lead a Quality Team in order to execute the departmental strategic goals through reports, feedback, insights and trends to stakeholders according to agreed standards.

Manage 'Next-Gen' Quality by consistently 'Raising-the-bar' on service-delivery standards & enable low-risk & zero-surprises BAU.

Ensure best use of systems and technology to deliver effectively and efficiently.

Ensure that the Quality team’s outputs meet stakeholder expectations in terms of quality, accuracy and targets.

Contribute towards Continuous Improvement initiatives to improve processes and systems at WNS and for our clients as well as personal and team skills - making sure that we have a Continuous Improvement map and plan for our client by adding meaningful value through insights, analytics and staying on the forefront of new technologies and processes.

Manage relationships with stakeholders according to company practice and your team according to WNS 5PP.


Qualifications
  • Qualifications Required

Essential

  • Matric/Grade 12 Certificate


Preferred

  • Tertiary qualification in Contact Centre Management or similar
  • Continuous Improvement E.g. Lean Six Sigma certification Yellow, Green Belt
  • MS Office
  • Travel experience


  • Experience Required

Essential

  • Minimum 3 years travel management experience
  • Computer literacy (MS Office) at an intermediate level - particularly MS Excel


Preferred

  • People management experience
  • Stakeholder management experience
  • Report writing and report presentation capability
  • Knowledge of contact centre technology
  • Knowledge of industry best practice
  • Lean Six Sigma
  • Root Cause Analysis


  • Behavioral Traits Required     (These are Behaviours that differentiate the “Good” from the “Great” at WNS)


  • Self-motivated
  • Team player

  • Effective emotional intelligence (EQ)
  • Effective communicator

  • Passionate about growing and developing own team

Essential

  • Leadership: call center leaders are in charge of people whom they would be expected to direct, manage and mentor. Therefore, they must have excellent interpersonal skills, leadership skills and abilities


  • Motivation    : people work harder when they receive the right amount of motivation, so call center leaders would be expected to know how to devise effective motivational techniques to improve the performance of their team

Product Manager II

LexisNexis, a part of RELX, is a leading global provider of legal, regulatory, and business information. We help customers increase productivity and improve decision-making and outcomes. Our 10,500 experts and innovative tools help us shape a better world for our customers and communities.

As a Product Manager, you'll own one or more product features and lead product development technical teams in executing development for those features. Owning product development plans, you'll coordinate and communicate with US/UK PMs to understand features, market needs and customers. You'll prioritize and communicate development defects and lead demonstrations to stakeholders at program milestones.

  • Interacting with UK/US PMs to fully understand user needs, understand pain-points and build solutions that make a difference.
  • Accessing market research and asking good questions to gain insights and understanding to make effective product decisions.

  • Have a proficient background in various technologies including Excel, Balsamiq, Tableau, Python and SQL.

display_title: Senior Business Analyst - Digital Technologies - Remote Work (Within SA)
job_description:
We are looking for a Digital Feature Analyst to join our rapidly growing digital team and assist us in recommending the best digital products/solutions to launch in various markets we operate in, to increase profitability within the company’s business and digital transformation vision.


The successful candidate will be responsible for clarifying business requirements, documenting associated user stories and acceptance criteria, through in-work collaboration with business stakeholders, cross functional teams and product owners across our business process services in finance, health and insurance etc, contributing to the accurate and effective end-to-end delivery of expectations. To assume the role of scrum master within the digital and business transformation and information technology teams, looking at market data to determine what digital products to launch and interviewing customers to understand their needs.


Ultimately, the candidate will work with our clients and various community of practice leaders in our organization to help us determine what digital products/solutions we should launch to maximize profitability and realization of our global digital business model.


Responsibilities:

  • Develop and oversee medium to large scale digital and business transformation projects.
  • Analyze metrics to continually improve company and client’s digital products.
  • Assist the company in achieving short and long-term goals relating to digital product growth.
  • Work with our community of practice leaders to improve the analysis and presentation of our digital products/solutions.
  • Proven work experience as a Business or Product Analyst within a digital environment or similar role.
  • Proficient in database software SQL, Oracle, Jira, Confluence, Celonis, PowerBi (Dax or M-Query languages), Programming Python & R (Business Analytics Packages).
  • Strong communication and negotiation skills, logical and critical thinking skills.
  • The ability to work under pressure and adapt to change.
  • Relevant training and/or certifications as a Business or Product Analyst.
  • Prioritize and Plan work activities within the Digital Feature role.
  • Manage the Backlog for the Digital Feature role.
  • Collaborate with the team to deliver on backlog.
  • Wear different hats: designer, tester, facilitator, product owner, etc.
  • Create a shared understanding of what the digital product is supposed to do.
  • Understanding business needs and be able to analyse requirements.
  • Ability to analyse statistics and other data, interpret and evaluate results, and create reports and presentations for use by other business stakeholders.
  • Evaluating the company’s digital products and comparing them against industry trends.
  • Developing an understanding of company products to meet the company's current and future needs.
  • Providing assistance with digital products and customer satisfaction, rating reviews and associated voice of customer technologies.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Degree in BCom Informatics or a related field.
  • Certifications in IIBA AAC/CBDA/CPOA or CCBA/CBAP or related.
  • Service Design, Design Thinking, Lean Six Sigma, Scrum or SAFe industry accredited certifications will be advantageous.
  • Consulting background will be advantageous.

Experience:

  • 2 - 3 years proven experience in requirement elicitation, gathering, documentation and management and analysing digital business needs and provide solutions, working in an agile environment.
  • 2 - 3 years good understanding of agile working practices, LEAN and SCRUM proficiency and working collaboratively across teams. Agile methodologies, digital business analysis, SDLC, requirements management and business support.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Behavioural Competencies:

  • Taking Action
  • Team Working
  • Adopting Practical Approaches (Pragmatic)
  • Embracing Change
  • Articulating Information

Technical Competencies:

  • Digital Business Analysis/ Feature Analysis
  • Digital, Data and IT Knowledge
  • Requirements Gathering and Management
  • Process Analysis, Focus Groups, Surveys & Interviews, Workshop Facilitations
  • Research & Information Gathering
  • Stakeholder Management (Digital, Data and IT)

Purpose of the Job:

Assist to increase efficiencies and dedicated business improvement initiatives.

Job Responsibilities:

SAFETY, HEALTH, ENVIRONMENT AND QUALITY
  • Identify and assess level of issue-based risk exposures in area of responsibility by considering exposures to business, financial, legal issues, people, equipment, material, environment, processes, etc.
  • Consider the level of risk, apply mitigation, and implement control measures for residual risk (set objectives, minimum requirements, etc.)
  • Manage SHEQ compliance within the Process through effective use of the Toolbox
  • Utilise the Integrated Management System (IMS) to initiate, investigate and report SHEQ status

CUSTOMERS
  • Ensure congenial relationship with Business Improvement stakeholders is established and maintained.
  • Provide continuous feedback regarding the level to which stakeholders' requirements are met.
  • Open communication and feedback channels - employees to participate in problem solving and decision making.
  • Networking - utilize / involve relevant people and business contacts.

BUSINESS PROCESSES
Analytical support
  • Effective analytical support provided for the Business Improvement function.
  • Act as primary resource for accessing relevant production and cost data.
  • Provide fact-base to help identify priorities, solve root-causes, and identify significant cost saving ideas.
  • Directly assist idea owners to complete idea forms.
  • Reinforce high standards for idea form requirements.
  • Provide analytic support for weekly review and for updates to relevant departments.
  • Maintain a database of ideas and oversee tracking of all ideas.
  • Ensure cost generating issues are critically analysed and evaluated.

  • Analyse cash cost and NCE and suggest improvement areas.
  • Ensure effective planning and implementation.
  • Meet business budgets (tons produced in an efficient manner),

Business improvement implementation assistance:

Improvement function:
