company: South African Bankers Services Company Pty Ltd
job_description:
Job Description:


BankservAfrica form part of the South African National Payments System and are a trusted partner of the financial industry, including banking institutions, and therefore require that employees adhere to unwavering standards of honesty and transparency in performing their duties.

PURPOSE

The main purpose of this role is to develop and analyse data warehousing in BankservAfrica, including data feeds, data quality, ETL and Mart development and to support the analytics strategy and projects via the provision, organisation and pre-processing of data. A key deliverable would include the analysis of data to facilitate the inclusion of new data sources into the Data Warehouse.

You will engage with the following stakeholders:

  • External Stakeholders
  • Executives
  • Change Management
  • Change Advisory Board
  • Infrastructure
  • Service Desk
  • Development Teams
  • Delivery
  • Service /Business Owners

Your key responsibilities include:

  • Identify and scope opportunities for improvement / innovation
  • Develop risk analysis framework
  • Deliver client or company specific projects in line with company standards and in agreement with line manager
  • Statistics
  • Stats and Reporting

QUALIFICATIONS


  • Data Related Qualification

EXPERIENCE

  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in related field
  • Experience in general office administrative duties
  • Banking/ Payment experience advantageous preference card payments
  • Data Base and Oracle experience advantageous
  • Required computer literacy levels

SKILLS

  • Advanced Excel
  • Strong SQL skills

Requirements:

  • An honours degree in economics, public health, biology, epidemiology, statistics, psychology computer science, or other quantitative social science field
  • Experience and confidence in conducting literature reviews spanning a range of research field
  • Strong skills in Stata, R, SPSS or Python
  • Strong statistical, analytic, and quantitative data interpretation skills
  • Moderate to strong exposure to econometric, impact evaluation or other causal inference techniques

Responsibilities:

  • Conducting literature reviews, detailing barriers to health for disadvantaged citizens in multiple African countries within and intersecting between health domains
  • Identifying evidence-based interventions addressing barriers drawing from public health, behavioural science, development economics and other research fields.
  • Identifying innovative and evidence-based instruments for measuring behavioural, clinical and psychological outcomes
  • Design surveys and other digital data-gathering methods to assist programme evaluation methods
  • Using quantitative statistical programmes and methods to clean and interpret data generated on mobile interventions.
  • Generating reports detailing demographics, behaviours and outcomes of various interventions.

Key purpose:

﻿﻿To collaborate with the respective support teams to run effectively and efficiently by providing operation and transactional support to the respective business units (Sales, Commercial, Marketing, EXCO, Board, Finance, Service Delivery etc.). SFDC data management, change control, reporting, dashboards and presentations. Creation and roll out of refreshable Power BI reporting (reporting automation) to provide business with a single view of truth. Provide insight into Sales date on trend analysis as well as future forecasting.

﻿Duties and responsibilities:

  • Support with the creation, review and revision of sales impacting processes
  • Ensure effective and efficient business analyst support is delivered to the sales organisation
  • Interface with the Finance/Commercial departments in terms of revenue management and pricing functions respectively
  • Adherence to internal SLA standard
  • Support in the creation and management of POC and support in ensuring deployment of the new imperatives and projects relating to sales insight and enablement
  • Produce accurate Reports, Dashboards and Presentation relating to sales performance and insight
  • Track Forecasting accuracy on a weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly. Track historic trends as well
  • Track end to end business activities and processes against sales growth to determine trends
  • Execute on the reporting framework to assist in pipeline management
  • Provide internal and external customer support for the development and implementation of Business requirement/s and solution.
  • Support the team to conclude key areas to achieve sales targets; monthly operations planning, progress reporting and execution plan.
  • Support the sales targeting process for the sales team and measurement of the sales performance.
  • Enables end to end business activities and processes that supports Strategic Customers sales division to run effectively.
  • Enable and control end to end Sales Process Development, Sales Process Adoption and Compliance by the sales teams, Product Development and Related Processes.
  • Accountable for accurate sales related reporting, dashboards, trend analysis and presentations
  • Accountable for automation of repetitive reporting requirements
  • Accountable for providing accurate and relevant data to drive sales strategies for key customers and solutions

﻿Qualifications and experience:

  • BComm Management / Diploma in Business/Finance Managment
  • Advantageous 1-3 years in the ICT/Telco sector experience
  • Relationship management experience and dealing with customers at all levels is a requirement.
  • Strong Excel experience and relevant technical/systems/CRM understanding (advantageous).
  • Report writing experience is required.
  • Understanding of the telecommunications customer value chain.
  • Good understanding of technology, products and services offered and the telecommunications industry would be advantageous.
  • Experience in dealing with cross-functional work groups.
  • Basic Finance and Contract management/legal knowledge.
  • Good knowledge of Buying / Selling cycles
  • Good knowledge about Pipeline Management and Revenue Generation

Job-related knowledge required:

  • Analytical Thinking
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills
  • Excellent client management skills and levels of professionalism
  • Highly motivated and self-discipline
  • Works independently (self-starter) or in a group
  • Process orientated and ability to adapt

﻿Required skills:

  • Financial Modelling/Calculations
  • Excel Formulas
  • ETL Tools
  • SQL and Databases
  • DataWarehouse platforms

display_title: Real Estate Business Development Manager Mr Price Group
job_description:
Real Estate Business Development Manager

your purpose

To optimize, identify and implement selected group real estate strategic operational projects, ways of working & initiatives by driving business improvements, innovation and efficiencies - communicating these projects and initiatives to MD and Divisional Directors. This includes managing the group energy and real estate maintenance initiatives that contribute to strategic objectives within the divisions.

your day to day responsibilities

Oversees and runs group Real Estate projects (new, special projects, optimization & sustainability) from initial meeting to completion to ensure project delivery within timing and budget. This includes the management of resources and teams required to deliver on the projects outcome.

Innovation and Business improvement Process
1. Addressing the change implications associated with process and continuous improvement .
2. Conduct regular retrospectives and process reviews to identify improvement opportunities.
3. Assess project risks and mitigate them.

Energy Optimization
1. Steer group energy initiatives to ensure usage is optimized through innovative solutions. Continuously look for opportunities to improve on current realities.

Innovation and Business Process
1. Identify new, innovative ways of working with the application of various new approaches and technologies to improve and streamline processes and to reduce risk.

Maintenance
1. Improvement and advancement of the Lease Eagle Management System

Business Analytics
1. Provide insight into strategic intiatives, renewals, return on spac, revamps as well as projects .
2. Thorough interpretation of property data, identify data trends and trends to report on and provide insights that enhance business decision making capability.
3. Maintain accurate and consistent property data that is readliy available.

Space/Real Estate
1. Implement and enforce strict feasibility and process protocalls to maximise the efficiency and profitability of new/existing space.


what are the requirements?

  • Tertiary Qualification in Project Management or related
  • 5 to 8 Years Experience in Project Management within Fashion Retail or Retail, Operational experience advantageous
  • Understanding of store fitting in Fashion Retail or Retail, understand construction.
  • Retail, Branding, Sustainability & Energy Optimisation, Lease Management, Space Management

more about us

Company Description
-The SHIRA Specialist is responsible for the management of risks and commitments.

Be part of the team. The team that makes it happen.

Anglo American has a portfolio of world-class mining operations. We mine, process, move and market the essential ingredients that enable a cleaner, more connected world and that meet fast growing consumer-driven demands for products from smartphones to electric cars. Our basic materials build homes, offices, railways and airports, and our diamonds fulfil people's dreams.

Anglo American Platinum

Our Platinum business mines, processes and refines the entire range of platinum group metals (PGMs): platinum, palladium, rhodium, ruthenium, iridium and osmium. We are the world’s leading primary producer of PGMs, which have a range of specialised applications that improve lives across the world, from vehicle fuel cells to jewelry; dentistry to glassmaking; pacemakers to petroleum refining.


Job Description
-As a SHIRA Specialist your responsibilities will include:

Safety & Health

  • Take personal responsibility for safety of self and others to ensure zero harm and elimination of fatalities
  • Consistently apply safety & health principles in all team interactions and take personal responsibility for safety of self and others to ensure zero harm and elimination of fatalities
  • Identify specific risks within working area and adhere to discipline-specific plans/system to avoid these risks

Performance & Delivery

  • Operational planning
  • Develop detailed response plan for priority unwanted events

Work management

  • Develop detailed response plan for priority unwanted events
  • Conduct proactive base line survey with communities to identify cultural heritage sites
  • Receive input from cultural heritage register provided by SAHRA
  • Update and monitor implementation of 'Chance Find Procedure'
  • Supervise construction work near cultural heritage sites
  • Update and monitor implementation of Cultural Heritage Management Plan
  • Implement control mechanisms as specified in the Cultural Heritage Management Plan
  • Advise on how to react in case of cultural heritage issues
  • Define and analyse priority unwanted events
  • Conduct bow-tie-analyses of social risks
  • Complete risk assessment for SP
  • Align risk assessment with SHE Team and Operational Risk Manager
  • Integrate risk actions into operating model
  • Advise on social risks
  • Manage social risks

Feedback

  • Monitor management measures to social risks
  • Advise on risk issues to operational head of the function
  • Identify key social and economic impacts and issues

Sustainability & Social

  • Drive delivery the sustainability activities as relevant to discipline and set out in the Life of Asset Plan to improve sustainability performance over time
  • Put in place sufficient physical and financial resources and coordinate delivery of Sustainable Mining Plan commitments relevant to discipline

People & Teams

  • Support the development of, and ultimately implement, a purpose-led, high-performing culture within the teams that is aligned with the company values, is inclusive and promotes diversity
  • Implement management processes for employee & contractor management within work area
  • Develop team members

Compliance

  • Ensure compliance of the discipline with external (legislative, regulatory, permitting) requirements
  • Ensure compliance of the discipline with Anglo American compliance requirements
  • Manage appeals to social incident procedure
  • Develop appropriate commitment policy

This role is in the Corporate Affairs & Sustainable Impact department at a Band 6 level reporting to the Social Performance Planning Section Manager


  • Qualifications
    -Undergraduate qualification in Social Sciences Degree or equivalent qualifications
  • Postgraduate qualification in Social Sciences Degree or equivalent qualifications (advantageous)
  • Qualification in Integrated Social Impact Assessments (advantageous)
  • Business / Project Management qualifications (advantageous)
  • Please ensure copies of all qualifications are submitted upon application

Experience, knowledge & skills required:

  • Minimum of 4 years Development Management / Social Performance experience of which at least 2 should be in a Mining environment
  • Project management fundamentals
  • Rural Participatory Facilitation
  • Business improvement tools and techniques (e.g. IsoMetrix, SmartSheets, etc.)
  • Data maintenance
  • Medically fit
  • Valid driver’s license
  • Compliance: Safety, health and environment, legislative, statutory, regulatory and permitting requirements

Additional Information
-What we offer

When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package, but more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We are a large, successful multinational company – and we are still growing all the time.

Who we are?

Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities, and countries in which we operate and for society at large. Anglo American is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives.

How we are committed to your safety

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

Background checks

Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

How to apply

To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

Anglo American / De Beers Group collects and processes personal data in accordance with the relevant regulations.

By applying for this job, you provide consent that your personal details, including your fingerprints, can be used to conduct background screening where appropriate.

Please see our privacy policy for further details

#LI-BH1

Cloud Software Engineer

Flexible location across South Africa; fully remote

Job Overview:

Take a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of one of the coolest professional adventures of the decade. If you are the Amazing " Cloud Software Engineer " we are searching for, you will become part of an amazing team that truly contribute to improve patients’ health all around the globe.

YOUR ROLE:

As a Cloud Software Engineer, you will be co-designing, building, testing and implementing software solutions. We are looking for someone who thinks outside the box, is passionate about innovation, challenges the status quo and has high energy levels.

We will require from you to be autonomous and proactive to provides subject matter expertise and a high level of internal consulting support on the analysis, design, programming, debugging, modification, and maintenance of software enhancements and/or new products.

YOUR TEAM:

You will be working within the development team building strong relationships with management, subject matter experts, application designers and system specialists. In this role you will be reporting to the Director of Software Engineering.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Understanding design principles and a detailed knowledge of database architectures
  • Designing tools for systems to meet business needs
  • Delivering technical visualisation of proposed application architecture to your technical lead
  • Contributes to best practice system and application design
  • Designing, coding and testing programs and scripts from agreed specification
  • Ensuring agreed standards and tools are in place to achieve a well-engineered product
  • Conducting releases to production environments and setting up post release reviews
  • Analysing release components
  • Takes part in reviewing own work and leads reviews of colleague’s work (unit testing, code review)
  • Supporting team members with technical challenges while following best practice methods
  • Contributing ideas and experience to new development solutions
  • Provide support in development processes and techniques
  • Maintaining knowledge of specific specialisms (e.g.: React JS, GoLang)
  • Developing specialist knowledge of database concepts and data modelling techniques.
  • Analysing data requirements to establish, adapt and maintain data models.
  • Close cooperation with development team and business to carry out builds and testing
  • Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs, modifies, and maintains software enhancements and/or new products used in local, networked, or Internet-related computer programs.
  • May interact with users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications.
  • Assists in the preparation of costs analyses and justifications of software enhancements and/or new products.
  • Completes documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance.
  • Monitors effective hardware utilization, reviews system logic for optimum throughput.
  • Code may be used in commercial or end-user applications, such as desktop applications, mobile apps or financial management.
  • Using current programming language and technologies, writes code, completes programming, and performs testing and debugging of applications.
  • May have responsibilities for process and/or people management.

YOUR EXPERIENCE:

  • Experience working in a similar position
  • 5+ years’ experience working as a Backend developer
  • Experience using build tools (Docker)
  • Exposure to JavaScript libraries and frameworks
  • Management of Linux Services
  • Good understanding of database design and management
  • Solid understanding of code versioning

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS:

Desired

  • Postgraduate qualifications in an IT related field
  • Five (5) years’ experience in systems and software development with Golang, Docker/Kubernetes, Rest, and Terraform
  • Microsoft Certifications. Experience with MS Azure, Spark, Devops pipeline, Graphql, Jenkins, Git and Agile would be nice to have.

OUR OFFER

  • A position in our organization where you can develop new initiatives
  • A chance to participate in the creation of business software that fits the way people work
  • Enthusiastic colleagues across teams who are keen on working with you and sharing their knowledge and expertise
  • Work with a leading international system in an international organization
  • A high level of flexibility and independence
  • Training on products and competences to further develop your in-depth knowledge and skills
  • A permanent contract and a remuneration according to your experience.

WHY JOIN?

Those who join us become part of a recognized global leader still willing to challenge the status quo to improve patient care.

You can drive your career at IQVIA and choose the path that best defines your development and success. With exposure across diverse geographies, capabilities, and vast therapeutic and information and technology areas, you can seek opportunities to change and grow without boundaries.

IQVIA is a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We believe that a work environment that embraces diversity will give us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and enhance our success. We believe that an inclusive and respectful workplace culture fosters a sense of belonging among our employees, builds a stronger team, and allows individual employees the opportunity to maximize their personal potential.

Learn more here: https://www.iqvia.com/library/videos/enhance-ux-content-targeting-and-compliance-for-hcp-apps-with-the-iqvia-healthcare-authenticator-sdk

We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

company: Travelstart Online Travel Operations Pty LTD
display_title: Key Accounts and Campaign Delivery Manager
job_description:
Job Description

    The following document outlines your key responsibilities & duties inclusive of the skill set required. The list is not exhaustive. As your career progresses within Travelstart we will expect you to grow and develop in your role. Any major changes in your Job Description will be noted. Your Job Description combined with your Key Performance Areas/Indicators will provide you with a robust guide of your expected level of performance.

Purpose of the role

    As a Campaign Delivery Manager, you will be the account manager responsible for media campaign delivery and management with your main partners being within the tourism board and trade organisations. Your role will involve working closely with these partners to develop and execute effective marketing campaigns that promote destinations, attractions, and tourism experiences. Your goal will be to drive visitor engagement, increase tourism revenue, and foster strong partnerships within the tourism industry. You will be responsible for the entire lifecycle of the campaign including the post campaign reporting and follow up. Skills required include generalist experience within the digital marketing space and strong relationship building abilities.

1) Work closely with Media Sales Team, Supply Team and Marketing Team

  • Assist sales team to build an offering that covers clients strategic objectives
  • Work together on strategies to fulfil these inline with Travelstart’s capabilities (aka do not let the sales team over promise!)

2) Client Relationship Management:

  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with key clients
  • Collaborate with clients to develop effective campaign strategies aligned with their business goals.
  • Update clients on campaign progress, performance, and opportunities

3) Campaign Strategy and Planning:

  • Work closely with clients to develop comprehensive campaign strategies and plans.
  • Define campaign objectives, KPIs, and metrics for success- internal
  • Collaborate with internal teams to develop campaign concepts and tactics.

4) Campaign Execution and Management:

  • Oversee the end-to-end campaign execution process, ensuring timely and accurate delivery.
  • Coordinate with marketing to deliver all campaign elements.
  • Monitor campaign performance, making data-driven decisions to optimise results.

5) Performance Tracking and Reporting:

  • Establish tracking mechanisms to measure campaign performance against set KPIs.
  • Analyse campaign data and provide actionable insights and recommendations.
  • Prepare regular reports on campaign performance.
  • Identify opportunities to upsell or cross-sell additional services to existing clients.

Experience & Skills Requirement

  • Digital Marketing and Campaign Management Experience
  • Basic knowledge of;
  • Social Media Marketing
  • Design
  • Content Creation
  • HTML / CSS
  • Javascript
  • Creative ability from conceptualisation to delivery
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact with partners, internal, teams, and key stakeholders.
  • Good problem-solving abilities to ensure any needs and concerns are addressed in a timely manner and long-standing ending relationships with partners
  • Ability to build bid decks on google slide templates (can be on-trained)
  • Ability to prepare reports from google analytics and Qlik (can be on-trained) 2

Package & Renumeration:

Attractive package market related, based on experience.

Disclaimer: Should you not receive feedback within two weeks of your application being submitted, kindly note that it means that your application was unfortunately unsuccessful.

Interested applicants must please email their CVs to recruitment@travelstart.com using the reference “Key Accounts and Campaign Delivery Manager”. Please insert this into the subject line of your email application. Any applicants not meeting the minimum requirements will not receive a response.

Please note that we reserve to right to amend, freeze the role or not hire. The final appointment will be at the discretion of Travelstart. Travelstart is committed to transformation and redressing of past inequalities. Our employment equity goals will be taken into account in our selection process.
Good luck!

Responsibilities:

  • Research and identification of new investment opportunities in key strategic sectors
  • Research and analysis of primary and secondary market investments, identifying new opportunities within these investments (both listed and unlisted)
  • Research and construct comparable company analyses and develop multiple projection scenarios through company and industry research
  • Support due diligence processes of direct equity and co-investment opportunities and assist with preparation of investment memoranda for the companys Exco and Investment Committee (a sub-committee of the Board)
  • Monitoring adherence to compliance matters and legal agreements.
  • Maintenance of investment models, portfolio data, and supporting analytics and regularly monitor portfolio company performance against base case and industry comparable companies
  • Implementation of mitigating strategies / policies for key risks facing the investment portfolio
  • Supporting the team in advising on and implementation of structuring and capital raising (both equity and debt) at an investment or holding company level.
  • Input for and assisting with preparation of quarterly valuations and portfolio reports for the Investment Committee and Board
  • Monitoring of existing investments and maintaining investee relationships including analysis of investee companies monthly management accounts, annual financial statements as well as high level engagement with the deal team to close knowledge gaps.
  • Generally, assist with and support the execution of exits from portfolio companies i.e. identification of potential exit avenues and the implementation of successful exit
  • Networking, liaising, and maintaining of relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Bachelor of Commerce / Bachelor of Business Science and Honours in Finance / Economics / Investments / Accounting.
  • Outstanding academic record.
  • Two to three years experience within the financial industry (Mergers & Acquisitions, corporate finance, investment analysis and management, prior experience in investment banking preferred.)
  • Strong understanding of financial modelling and valuation methodologies.
  • Deep research and analytical skills.
  • Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills.

Job Description:

We are looking to recruit an UX Researcher to join the product design team.

Job Purpose:

To research UX best-practices, competitors and user needs. Conducts user-testing, analyses data to inform design process. Manages content for certain projects/areas.

Job objectives:

  • To support the product design team in delivering digital touchpoint experiences that our customers engage with
  • To support the product design team in developing customer journey strategies that consistently improve the customer experience for Absa CIB and drive a customer centric culture throughout the business
  • To research UX best practices across both competitors and user needs requirements
  • To analyze CX and UX data to inform our UX design process
  • To collaborate with stakeholders and design team members

Minimum requirements:

Essential

Desirable

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree/Diploma in media, marketing, research, digital marketing (or relevant discipline)

Join this listed FSP as an Senior Manager: Data Engineering. You will be responsible for leading this company’s enterprise data strategy and data platform. Lead the data engineering function responsible for the unlocking of value from the company’s data assets. Set data strategy, research and implementation of new data tools and processes to drive ROI. Be a data thought leader for the company.

Responsibilities:


Data and Analytics Strategy:


  • Create and execute a long-term strategy for leveraging data and analytics as a key business enabler and competitive differentiator across the business. To be able to research tools to plan, implement and build all business and technical aspects of different data and analytics systems and platforms.


Data Management:


  • Take responsibility for developing and delivering a key element of the organisation's data management system.


Data Architecture/Engineering:


  • Translate data and analytics strategy and vision into data architecture, defining and implementing models, rules, and standards for design and governance.


Design and Conceptualisation:


  • Lead a collaborative digital product/service design process by gathering input across all product/service portfolios to define a design system that is viable and scalable, and which strengthens the brand. Lead a cross-portfolio, multidisciplinary team that contributes to the evolution of the system.


Continuous Improvement:


  • Lead the review of existing operations and the implementation of innovation processes across the division or function to ensure the required continuous improvement outcomes are delivered.


Leadership and Direction:


  • Communicate the function's strategy and its relationship to the organisation's mission, vision and values; clarify the actions needed to implement it within the rea of responsibility; motivate people to commit to these and to doing extraordinary things to achieve the organisation's business goals.


Performance Management:


  • Manage and report on the performance of the function / business area; set appropriate performance objectives for direct reports and hold them accountable for achieving these; take appropriate corrective action where necessary to ensure the achievement of annual business objectives.


Project Management:


  • Manage a portfolio of major projects in line with overall project management strategy.


Stakeholder Engagement:


  • Identify and manage stakeholders up to top management level, finding out their needs/issues/concerns and reacting to these by leading and coordinating the development of stakeholder engagement plans to support the communication of business information and decisions.


Behavioral Competencies:


Manages Complexity:


  • Makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems. For example, sees the systematic elements of issues' the major connections, linkages, and interdependencies. Ensures the organization has reliable ways to gather needed information.


Tech Savvy:


  • Anticipates and adopts innovations in business-building digital and technology applications. For example, supports the use of the latest technologies to improve organizational results, making resources available. Stays apprised of technology trends and of how they can make a substantial difference.


Cultivates Innovation:


  • Creates new and better ways for the organization to be successful. For example, allocates resources to build a solid innovation portfolio and take advantage of new opportunities. Fosters a climate that supports and rewards creativity and innovation; removes obstacles to creativity.


Ensures Accountability:


  • Holds self and others accountable to meet commitments. For example, emphasizes accountability, measures organizational performance against goals, addresses poor team performance, does not accept blaming others or excuses.


Drives Results:


  • Consistently achieves results, even under tough circumstances. For example, urges the organization to focus on the topics that matter to business performance. Eliminates barriers to organizational performance. Provides reinforcement and support to help people overcome obstacles.


Communicates Effectively:


  • Develops and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences. For example, ensures a free flow of information throughout the organization. Delivers messages effectively to all levels of the organization; creates forums for people to express themselves openly and regularly.


Builds Effective Teams:


  • Builds strong-identity teams that apply their diverse skills and perspectives to achieve common goals. For example, builds a leadership team that advances organizational strategies. Enables cross-functional teamwork; builds team spirit across the organization. Models teamwork; partners well with a wide range of leaders.


Collaborates:


  • Builds partnerships and works collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives. For example, promotes a culture of collaboration across boundaries, where people can express themselves honestly; addresses major barriers to collaboration. Seeks out a broad range of perspectives to address issues.


Decision Quality:


  • Makes good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward. For example, ensures that people internalize policies and standards and accept full responsibility for their decisions. Confidently makes choices in the best interests of the organization, deals constructively with resistance.


Situational Adaptability:


  • Adapts approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations. For example, is a powerful role model for adaptability; adeptly shifts approach and helps others do the same. Can be both persistent and flexible, as needed. Helps others adapt swiftly to new situations.


Being Resilient:


  • Rebounds from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations. For example, shows appropriate stability and resilience in crises; puts the situation in perspective, helps the organization stay focused; helps the organization move forward. Stays persistent in the face of adversity or obstacles; urges others to adopt a similar approach.


Skills:


System Management:


  • Operates as a recognised expert to manage projects and monitor applications using enterprise systems and tools. Typically known as a subject matter authority.


Computer skills:


  • Acts as the organisation's authority and established expert on understanding and using tools in the domain of data engineering.
  • Python., Pyspark, Spark, Databricks, SQL, SAS


IT Implementation and integration:


  • Applies expertise to act as the organisational authority on implementing, configuring and optimising IT systems and services, while ensuring smooth integration with existing IT infrastructure.


Data Management:


  • Acts as the organisational authority and established expert on acquiring, organising, protecting and processing data to fulfill business objectives.


Policy and procedures:


  • Uses comprehensive knowledge and skills to work independently while providing guidance and training to others on developing, monitoring, interpreting and understanding policies and procedures, while making sure they match organisational strategies and objectives.


Data mining:


  • Works at an advanced level to extract patterns from large amounts of data. Typically works independently and provides guidance.


Education:


  • Grade 12/ SAQA Accredited Equivalent (Essential)
  • 3 year degree in Information Technology / Sciences / Informatics / Applied Mathematics / Statistics / Data Mining (Essential)
  • Master’s Degree in Information Technology / Sciences / Informatics / Applied Mathematics / Statistics / Data Mining (Advantageous)


Experience:

  • 5 or more years' experience of leading teams (Essential)

The Specialist: Treasury Operations will be accountable to achieve the following objectives:

  • Perform the daily operational cash management process for the Holding Companies, including funding of bank accounts.
  • Monitor cash balance to ensure compliance with concentration risk.
  • Perform cashflow forecasting to facilitate the improvement of cash positions.
  • Identify and enhance the daily cashflow forecasting by preparing transactions analytics and variance reports to understand the key drivers of cash flows.
  • Contribute to cash improvement projects and insights into holding companies cash positions.
  • Monitor market rates and update treasury management system.
  • Provide market rates and economic data to internal clients.
  • Conduct foreign exchange transactions (spots, forwards, swaps, etc).
  • Execute transactions for Money Market portfolio.
  • Manage foreign exchange exposures, interest rates exposure and money market portfolios against respective benchmarks.
  • Liaise with internal clients regarding cash, interest rates and foreign exchange requirements.
  • Liaise with banks regarding market movements and products.
  • Prepare / contribute to daily, weekly and monthly reports.
  • Ensure compliance to central bank guidelines for foreign exchange deals/transactions.
  • Be the custodian of banking relationship.
  • Execute approved risk management trades and strategies, that includes booking of trades on Treasury Management System.

Job Summary
We are seeking a senior quantitative analyst with proven experience in developing pricing models for derivatives. The ideal candidate will have extensive knowledge of financial markets, risk management, quantitative analysis and be familiar with regulatory capital frameworks. This role will report to the Head of Market Risk and Capital Analytics within the Global Markets division.
Job Description
Ideal candidate will have:
Advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in a quantitative field such as mathematics, engineering, or statistics.
  • At least 5 years of experience in a quantitative role in a financial institution.
  • Knowledge of financial products and derivative pricing models.
  • Strong object-oriented programming skills in C# or other programming languages like C++, Java, or Python.
  • Proven experience with regulatory capital metrics such as SA-CCR, FRTB-SA, SA-CVA and SIMM or willingness to learn these.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to work independently or as part of a team
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Role
  • Develop and maintain quantitative models for derivative pricing and risk management.
  • Build and maintain capital models used by front office for decision making.
  • Work closely with IT teams to integrate software systems and maintain data quality
  • Work closely with the Traded Market Risk team and provide quantitative support where necessary
  • Provide feedback to the Head of Market Risk and Capital Analytics on a regular basis.
Education
